Description:
American Express Card Members can contact us via different mediums - chat, email, voice call, or via walking into any of the contact centers. Our business area is in the realm of chat, where American Express offers Click-to-Chat as a medium of contact to all of its all customers. The online banking system is designed to address high-contact drivers, proactively assisting card members struggling to replace their cards or making payments online while reducing cost-to-service. It enables the card members to interact real time in their journey of choice increasing customer satisfaction.
 
 The Click-to-Chat process supports the card members, encompassing anyone who has an account domiciled in the US that provide services ranging from assisting card members making payments or trying to replace their cards.
 
Job Responsibilities:


Ability to comprehend and respond to all customer queries through chat with immediate resolution (real time) to ensure customer satisfaction. 

Deliver to the employees, customer and shareholder metrics as per goals. 

Adherence to quality and compliance guidelines 

Communicates effectively through written communication

Ability to recognize tone and mood of customer through chat conversations 

Adaptable and customer centric approach to situations to deliver superior service 

Personalization/ Empathy in communication 

Ability to address 2-3 conversations simultaneously 

Recognizes knowledge gaps and researches to respond              
What’s in it for you?


Attractive base pay

Highly competitive performance-based bonus

Health, dental, vision and life insurance

Free HMO coverage from day 1 for the employee and dependents. No maximum number of dependents. Employee may enroll as many as possible as their dependent so long as they're eligible.

Retirement Fund

Career development including trainings and career growth

Generous maternity/paternity paid leave

Private mother’s room

Onsite gym

Fitness studio

Fun karaoke room

On-site clinic
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.Qualifications

6 months to 2 years of chat experience in financial services / customer service

At least college-level education

Typing speed of at least 30 WPM with 90% accuracy

Quick Navigation Ability, Web Savvy, Basic Troubleshooting Knowledge 

Multitasking: Ability To Toggle Between Screens/Tools

Description:
You won’t just shape the world of software.
You’ll shape the world of life, work and play.
 
Our Software Engineers not only understand how technology works, but how that technology intersects with the people who count on it every day. Today, innovative ideas, insight and new perspectives are at the core of how we create a more powerful, personal and fulfilling experience for all our customers. So if you’re interested in a career creating breakthrough software and making an impact on an audience of millions, look no further.
 
You won’t just keep up, you’ll break new ground. 
 
There are hundreds of opportunities to make your mark on technology and life at American Express. Here’s just some of what you’ll be doing:
 

Taking your place as a core member of an agile team driving the latest development practices
Writing code and unit tests, working with OFSAA
Identifying opportunities for adopting new technologies
Leading a team of engineers that delivers knowledge management solutions to businesses worldwideQualificationsAre you up for the challenge?
 

Preferably a BS or MS degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other technical discipline
7+ years of software development experience in OFSAA, reg reporting
Ability to effectively interpret technical and business objectives and challenges and articulate solutions
Willingness to learn new technologies and exploit them to their optimal potential
At the core of Software Engineering
 
Every member of our team must be able to demonstrate the following technical, functional, leadership and business core competencies, including:
 

Agile Practices
Porting/Software Configuration
Programming Languages and Frameworks
Business Analysis
Analytical Thinking
Business Product Knowledge
Why American Express 
 
Talk to our people and you’ll find out what we’re really all about. Open, creative, risk-taking, collaborative and innovative are just some of the expressions you’ll hear. It’s our culture that makes American Express an outstanding place to work, and a big part of why we regularly win best workplace awards all over the world. If you’re ready to take on a challenge and make an impact, you owe it to yourself to launch or grow your career here.
 

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

Why
American Express? There’s
a difference between having a job and making a difference. American
Express has been making a difference in people’s lives for over 160 years, backing
them in moments big and small, granting access, tools, and resources to take on
their biggest challenges and reap the greatest rewards. We’ve
also made a difference in the lives of our people, providing a culture of
learning and
collaboration, and helping them with what they need to succeed and thrive. We have
their backs as they grow their skills, conquer new challenges, or even take

with their family or community. And when they’re ready to take on a new career path,
we’re right there with them, giving them the guidance and momentum into the best
future they envision. Because
we believe that the best way to back our customers is to back our people. The
powerful backing of American Express.Don’t
make a difference without it.
Don’t
live life without it.
ReqID: 18009339Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Jul 30, 2018, 5:36:25 PM

American Express is a global service company, providing customers with exceptional access to products and experiences that enrich lives and build business success.


 
Each day, we make it easier, safer and more rewarding for consumers and businesses to purchase the things they need and for merchants to sell their goods and services, enabling them to do and achieve more.
 
We’re committed to becoming the world’s most respected service brand and daily deliver extraordinary service to our customers, constantly reinventing our ways of working to ensure we offer rich rewards that redefine expectations for our clients and ourselves.
 
If you are passionate about delivering extraordinary service, results driven and interested in working for a world-class global brand, then the position with American may be an ideal fit for you. 
 
In this role you will ensure extraordinary customer service by swiftly and accurately responding to phone calls from our customers, making it easy to do business with us, while solving customer issues and celebrating their value to us. The role also involves back office tasks such as mail correspondence and cases from our external and internal customers and customer facing service. This role is part of a multilingual team and with an array of varied tasks and responsibilities.
 
To complete your application please click on the links below. However, if you require any assistance with the completion of this process – or need any reasonable adjustments to be made – then please contact the Recruitment Team on recruitment.support.uk@aexp.com or 00800 83 000038 (for Russia based candidates 810 800 83 000038).
Qualifications

Do you have what takes to build a career here?



Customer service experience with exceptional listening and relationship building skills  
Ability to speak either German, Finnish, Dutch, Swedish or Norwegian.
Strong written and verbal communication in the languages as shown and English
Willingness to work shifts
Ability to work in a fast paced metric driven environment
Proficient at multitasking and navigation in a Windows environment
Our roles are across various departments within our EMEA Headquarters in Central Brighton, these teams include:
 
Fraud, Merchant Services, Corporate Servicing, Credit, Global New Accounts, Customer Fulfilment Network!
 
 
Why American Express?
Talk to our people and you’ll find out what we’re really all about. Open, creative, risk-taking, collaborative and innovative are just some of the expressions you’ll hear. It’s our culture that makes American Express an outstanding place to work, and a big part of why we regularly win best workplace awards all over the world. If you’re ready to take on a challenge and make an impact, you owe it to yourself to launch or grow your career here.
 
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by law.

We place great importance on doing what is right, what is best and what is innovative. And we continue seeking people to champion these values and beliefs as we grow. The world’s a big place, filled with big ideas and amazing people. And we want the best of them here at American Express. We’re interested in where you came from, but we’re even more excited about where you will go with American Express.

Description:
You won’t just shape the world of payments.  You’ll shape the
world of life, work and play.
 
American Express is embarking on a journey to drive agile
marketing solutions and enabling innovative, high-quality marketing for the enterprise,
while also transforming end-to-end marketing processes and platforms. Today,
innovative ideas, insight and new perspectives are at the core of how we create
a more powerful, personal and fulfilling experience for all our
customers.  So if you’re interested in a career creating breakthrough
marketing and platforms while making an impact on an audience of millions, look
no further.
 
You won’t just keep up, you’ll break new ground.
 
There are hundreds of opportunities to make your mark on marketing
execution, technology, and life at American Express.  You’ll be challenged
everyday as we transform our organization to meet the customers of tomorrow as
part of Enterprise Marketing Platforms & Solutions (EMPS), a global
organization that sits within Enterprise Digital & Analytics (EDA).
 
Here’s just some of what you’ll be doing:
 
This position sits within the Enterprise Marketing Platforms
organization in Enterprise Marketing Platforms & Solutions (EMPS). 
The Enterprise Marketing Platforms team brings together all marketing execution
and workflow platforms into a single product team and is responsible for all
aspects of the product lifecycle in enabling end-to-end marketing execution
globally, innovating on behalf of our customers, and creating product
experiences that significantly improve colleague efficiencies and experiences,
as well as being the foundation of enabling competitively-differentiated,
customer-first marketing to our end customers. 
 
You’ll be part of the Marketingforce Platform team, whose mission
is to drive value by delivering reliable, flexible and scalable solutions that
improve speed to market, support growth, enable operational efficiencies, while
providing a best-in-class customer experience.  As an analyst for the Marketingforce
team, you will be joining a team of 3 Senior Product Managers, and will have
responsibility for a variety of critical functions including but not limited
to:   
 
Facilitation of the platform issues management process

Monitor
     and troubleshooting of new issues across the marketing ecosystem,
     specifically Marketingforce
Assessing
     priority and level of urgency and manage assignment of issues
Leading
     issue calls with stakeholder teams (Technologies, Product, Campaign
     Delivery, Marketing)
Tracking
     next steps, capturing roadblocks/dependencies and leading the escalation
     process based on urgency of the issue
Document
     and review standard operating procedures for issues and facilitate
     transition to Level 1 support team
Providing
     monthly leadership VP-level updates on the overall issue landscape

Product Development

Responsible
     for managing regular Platform activities including: Demos, Infoshares,
     Status meetings, Sandbox refresh and Release processes, etc
Work
     closely with the Managers on the team to create and execute on long-term
     strategic Roadmap
Partner
     with the Product Owner to translates product roadmap features ((tied to
     issues or other general business-generated items) into well-defined
     product requirements/user stories and acceptance test criteria
Manage
     admin data activities and related processes including documentation
Participate
     in testing and advance automated test coverage
Support
     release activities, including: tracking closure of high-priority defects,
     creating release documentation and post-install testing activities
Become
     a SME on development/ product best practices and success metrics
Define,
     measure and report on metrics related to product launch, process
     efficiency and performance

Oversight of the Marketingforce Wiki/Confluence page and Knowledge
articles

Working
     to define the overarching structure of our product wiki page, ensuring
     that there is a clear and defined structure for the content posted
Working
     across the stakeholder community to understand needs for the Wiki
Taking
     the lead on drafting content / training documentation for particular
     product items
QualificationsA successful candidate will have:

Bachelor’s
     in Computer Science or technical field or equivalent experience is a plus.
Minimum
     1 years’ experience working in an Agile environment;  Scaled Agile
     Framework and principles is a plus
Experience
     in, and passion for, one or more of the following areas: product,
     capabilities, business architecture/analysis, salesforce, marketing,
     technology development is highly desired
Strong
     communication and technical skills with the ability to quickly grasp
     technical issues/concepts
Strong
     problem solving, analytical and decision making skills
Strong
     relationship management skills, with a proven ability to communicate
     effectively across large, cross-functional teams and stakeholders
Experience
     with B2C Marketing or Card Marketing plus
Experience
     building Salesforce applications preferred.  Certifications (ADM 201,
     ADM 301, ADM 401) and experience with Service Cloud and Lightning UI a
     plus.

The
Instructional Designer is responsible for the design, development and quality
of effective learning materials for American Express Travel and Lifestyle
Services. They will partner with other learning professionals and Business Partners
in delivering globally consistent training that directly impacts the success of
American Express and our internal and external clients. The goal of all
programs is to deliver a world-class learning experience and drive positive
business results. 
 
The ability
to communicate effectively in visual, oral and written form (in both English
and Japanese) and deliver engaging presentations are critical skills for
success.  The ideal candidate will be experienced in
designing Instructor-led Training (ILT) materials, including PowerPoint
presentations, Facilitator and Participant Guides, and job
aids. E-learning design and development experience is also desirable.
 
Offer of
employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion
of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.Qualifications
Proven
     experience designing Instructor-led Training (ILT) materials
Proven
     experience using Microsoft Office products including Word, PowerPoint and
     Excel
Good
     understanding of adult learning theory and instructional design principles
Excellent
     verbal and written communication skills in both English and Japanese
Experience
     of designing new hire, product knowledge and software training preferred
Experience
     of using e-learning development tools (including Articulate Storyline and
     Captivate) desirable but not essential
Ability
     to work in a team environment 
3
     years of on-the-job experience in an Instructional Design role is
     preferred
This role may be subject to additional background verification checks.
ReqID: 18007318Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: May 30, 2018, 2:46:22 AM

Assist in the investigation of fraud and other criminal misconduct committed against American Express, its products, service, employees and facilities in Japan.  
 
Job responsibilities include but are not limited to:
 
Conduct complex internal and external investigations involving organized criminal groups and online (cyber) activities; collect intelligence on organized groups that commit financial crimes
 
Contribute to the development of investigative policies and procedures
 
Collect and compile documentary evidence; assist with forensic examinations.
 
Interview victims, claimants, witnesses, suspects and potential suspects
 
Network with local and national law enforcement agencies to investigate and prosecute crimes
 
Work with internal groups to reduce risk and exposure to fraud
 
Supervise direct reports and/or mentor less experienced investigators; oversee case assignments and entry into department database
 
Plan and monitor budget expenses
 
Support department activities in the areas of Crisis Management, Security Services, Executive Protection and other tasks as determine by the Director-Greater China and Japan
 
Work on site at Ogikubu/Tokyo. On call 24/7/365
 

Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

 QualificationsBachelor's Degree or other 4 year degree in criminal justice, investigations or business with emphasis on financial services,  professional certification or equivalent 
 
Long-term documented experience in law enforcement and/or corporate investigative work with emphasis on financial crimes
 
Highly developed investigative skills including experience with cyber crimes
 
Superior relationship management skills to develop and maintain productive contacts in the law enforcement and business communities
 
Strong leadership, time management, interpersonal and team work skills; superior computer skills
 
Must be able to read, write and converse in Japanese and English; good public speaker who is comfortable addressing diverse groupsReqID: 18004247Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Jul 4, 2018, 10:00:00 AM

Partner with stakeholders to understand the problems they’re trying to solve, and structure analyses to address their business needs. The successful candidate will have excellent business acumen and an ownership mindset. We are not looking for an order taker who will produce data without first understanding the business problem.
Be able to independently extract data out of Big Data technologies, and produce impactful analyses with clear, actionable business insights. You are able to synthesize complex analyses and communicate succinctly with internal and external stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Have a strong attention to detail, high standards when it comes to data quality, and the ability to discover, cleanse and merge data across disparate data sources. 
Working experience of travel domain, working knowledge of GDS Sabre and travel agencies functions.  
Should have an agile/scrum methodology experience.
 Qualifications
BS in Computer Science, Information Systems or Business Management or similar field is highly desirable or equivalent work experience 
Proven track record (3+ years) leading successful Analytics projects that help drive business and product decisions in a fast paced and complex environment.
Excellent data analytics skills using Big Data technologies such as, Hive SQL, Datameer etc.
Excellent reporting and data visualization skills ideally with Tableau and Excel.  
Excellent communication skills and the ability to effectively communicate complex analyses to internal and external stakeholders at all levels.
Good to have Rally/JIRA experience.
Positive attitude and a team player with a “roll up your sleeves” mindset.

Responsible for assisting with activities designed to systematically manage information security, such as security investigations, intelligence, assurance, and awareness, and/or other project oversight, including developing best practices for information security standards and managing IT controls and compliance with regulatory guidance. 
 
Organizational Context Works with technology and business partners across business functions/processes to ensure alignment, understanding and ongoing communication on security controls, compliance and information security risk management. Works individually and with teams on both structured and unstructured assignments. 
 
Key Responsibilities:       

Assists in developing, implementing and monitoring compliance to AXP and Information security policies, standards and procedures, and other policies and standards as appropriate  
Enforces security policies by administering and monitoring profiles, reviewing violation reports and investigating possible exceptions; document controls 
Prepares materials (reports, presentations, spreadsheets, etc) on information security to help develop scenarios, response procedures, and to enable informed decision making; verify completeness, accuracy and relevance of data gathered 
Utilizes tools and documented processes to ensure consistency and optimization of information security processes; work in support of efforts to measure and improve information security processes 
Prepares status reports on information security, or other matters to help develop, track, monitor and report on projects and initiatives 
Consults on controls, processes, and procedures 
Facilitates meetings to gather and document products/services or generic process changes 
Maintains internal documentation library, ensuring that process and other documentation is regularly updated to reflect latest operational processes and requirements 
Provides root cause analysis assistance for incident management or post-implementation efforts 
Provides analytical support as needed for issue management, project assessments, and reporting 
Participates in the evaluation of products and/or procedures to enhance productivity and effectiveness 
Supports the analysis of underlying trends and action plans associated with information security and other domains 
Maintains records to allow for historical trending analysis 
Accountable for ensuring security best practices, policies, and procedures are implemented and adhered to 
  
 

 Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field preferred (or equivalent work experience)
Certification may be required for specific functions
Up to 6 years of information security experience
Experience with gathering functional requirements, deployment of information security tools, and data analysis
In-depth experience with desktop software and office automation tools
High-performing Behaviors:

Analyzes complex information and identifies the most relevant details
Shows personal determination and resilience; is optimistic in changing circumstances
Continually seeks and learns from feedback
 Is clear when explaining ideas and concepts to others - communication is structured, compelling, and impactful, and creates a credible impression
 Involves the right people to ensure the best decisions are made in a timely manner
Challenges the status quo and questions current approaches where appropriate
Continually looks for contingency options and proactively adapts plans and priorities
Takes the initiative to create clarity when changing circumstances cause ambiguity
Translates and interprets AXP business strategies to clarify direction for self and/or team and to gauge impact on current plans
Knowledge/Skills:

Strong work prioritization, planning, and organizational skills
Knowledge or awareness in information security, compliance, assurance, and/or other security best practices and principles.
Passion for learning

Adaptive Communication

We’re looking for a QA Engineer to work on mobile applications that will be used by tens of millions of American Express cardholders around the world. We want someone with strong technical skills and creativity. Should enjoy solving tough problems and working with new technologies. You should not be shy about sharing your ideas and be obsessive about user experience and high quality.
You’ll be part of the Mobile Engineering team whose mandate is to develop new products and platforms for American Express customers. Mobile Engineering’s aim is to build interactive experiences at all touch points of a consumer's journey whether before, at, or after the time of purchase.
You’ll be working in a fast-paced environment with the stability of working for a Fortune 100 company. Your primary responsibilities will be to work on a small team of engineers developing mobile products. You should be familiar with modern software development methodologies and be able to dive deep and rapidly iterate on ideas despite ambiguity.
Responsibilities:

Contribute in an agile team by driving user story analysis and feature grooming, designing and developing thorough test-cases and test scenarios.

Job Description
The Global Consumer Services Technologies (GCST) team is responsible for implementing and supporting systems for the consumer and commercial card businesses in the US. A substantial program of work is underway within GCST to create products for US and international consumers, and to refresh existing products to make them more compelling for customers.
 
We are seeking an experienced Technical Project Manager with a strong technology background to join our team in New York. We are that rare employer you’ve been seeking - a financial services company with growth, funding, and a lively culture enriched with Amex Blue Box values. As a Technical Project Manager, we’ll put your leadership skills to work helping individuals and teams accelerate delivery and speed to market our unique card products and services by understanding, using and mastering Scrum. 
 
This Technical Project Manager is responsible for planning, directing, and coordinating strategic new product launches/initiatives within our Global Consumer Services Technology from definition through implementation, and has the following responsibilities: 

Manages integrated teams to deliver technology solutions in support of key product initiatives by working closely with product managers, technical project managers, architects, engineers, and QA teams
Works within and across business units to prioritize, plan, and execute the development schedule for major product releases
Manages and tracks status, financials, and other KPIs in relation to the plan and published progress reports
Assigns development resources to activities and monitors progress, performance across resource channels
Maintains dependency plan between planned sprints/work-streams across American Express Technologies (AET) development teams, infrastructure, external partners and third parties
Manages and escalates risks, issues, and changes tied to the product development initiatives
Applies judgment and discretion on when to raise issues versus work through issues with the team
Resolves issues precluding engineers from making progress against plans and deadlines
Ensures deliverables across technology teams are high-quality and clearly documented
Conducts Pre-PI Planning sessions, daily stand-ups and retrospectives at the end of each planned unit of work, Scrum of Scrums, and ensures that the team is continuously learning from the past 
Identifies opportunities to adopt innovative technologies and processesQualifications

This highly energetic Technical Project Manager must have: 

10+ years of IT experience with 5+ years of project management experience managing medium to large software development projects
Deep understanding of all aspects of software design with a demonstrated track record of increasing responsibility and ownership
End-to-end project/program management and delivery experience is required
Experience understanding technology solutions at an enterprise-level is preferred
Experience managing Agile, Scrum, or other rapid application development teams to deliver technology solutions on time, on budget, and to the scope
Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to effectively communicate across third parties and technical and business product managers
Experience in clarifying objectives, dealing with ambiguity/under-defined problems, advocating for simplification, and influencing teams
Demonstrated willingness to learn new technologies
Passion to enable business capabilities through innovation
Knowledge and working experience of Amex internal core platforms, systems and SORs is a plus

PMI or equivalent project management certification is a plus

American Express is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic team of highly skilled infrastructure and application support engineers. The group is nimble, and creative, with the power to shape our technology, by transforming the platform to a high availability and resiliency architecture. This is a great opportunity to join the Authorizations Technology organization and be part of a journey to transform, and support, the most critical platform within American Express. 
 
Authorizations is the company platform providing real time decisions for all proprietary and network transactions (card & non-card) globally, by assessing the credit and fraud risk characteristics of a transaction. It also plays a key role in multiple core business functions, including Customer Servicing, Merchants Payables, Account Management, Billing and Payments. We are looking for a top talented leader to define, lead and execute against a very ambitious vision.
 
Some of the key traits we are looking for: deep technical knowledge, experience with engineering and supporting high availability platforms; set, drive and deliver technical goals, make bold decision making and have the tenacity to deliver on the vision.
 
Does the above sound like an exciting next step on your career journey?
 





Creative problem-solving
 
We enjoy working on hard problems together because the hardest challenges are often the most rewarding.
 
 

Shape the world you want
 
Help improve small businesses, corporations, consumers to interact in a friction free manner.
 

Welcoming for everyone
 
We want to create a workplace and product set that is inclusive and reflects the diversity of our customers
 

In this role you will:
As the Vice President, High Availability Systems for the American Express Authorizations Platform, you will be responsible for providing infrastructure and application 24X7 support for the current Authorizations eco-system on Mainframe TPF, Distributed Linux and Oracle, as well as support and influencing the engineering of high availability on a new modern technology. 
 

Lead a team to provide infrastructure and application support for High Availability Authorization systems (i.e. Mainframe, TPF and Distributed) setting the standard for the enterprise. Implement next generation resilience (i.e. Chaos engineering, etc.)
Be the change agent to drive and deliver innovation while leading teams within a DevOps and Agile (SAFe) environment
Implement world class CI/CD tools and practices including synthetic test data management, identify and drive automation across the portfolio
Cultivate an environment of continuous improvement, driving modern engineering practices
Lead innovation such as AI/Machine Learning to enhance capabilities
Provide executive level verbal and written communication during problem situations and transformation activities
Partner with stakeholders to ensure alignment of service level agreements and targets, as well as strategies, tools and processes that help deliver Capability and Availability targets. 
Partner with the Global Infrastructure organization in owning the day-to-day operations to improve quality, performance and availability.  Work with the global service organization (bridge management) to handle all business critical incidents impacting the portfolio. 
Accountable for the delivery of ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) processes for the applications within their portfolio, including incident management, problem management and change management. 
Optimize customer experience by driving innovative continuous improvement programs with the goal to improve availability, costs, and time to market. 
Identify and implement strategies to attract and maintain a highly technical and engaged workforce with business and industry experience.  Develop, reward and energize a competent, effective team within the Authorizations organization.
 
Your performance is measured by the achievement of high availability targets, CI/CD, test automation and strategies you implement; and, by your ability to lead and inspire a high-performing cross-functional team that includes Infrastructure and Production Support, Engineering and Operations.QualificationsHere is what we are looking for:

10+ years of prior relevant Technology and business/industry work experience including high availability architecture design and deployment, systems life cycle management, infrastructure and data center planning and operations experience.
10+ years of experience leading multiple, large, multi-functional teams or projects
Loves dealing with fast pace, changing needs, and constraints
Technical fluency - an ability to convey complex technical information, both verbal and written, to varied audiences and succeed in a participatory and consensus-driven environment through constructive engagement
Highly organized - you can demonstrate ability to shift gears in response to changing needs
A history of leveraging both automation and operations teams to scale execution
Extensive hands-on experience building and managing the development of high availability strategies of complex, large scale enterprise applications, platforms and products that require a deep understanding of application logic and dependencies.
Proven experience attracting, hiring, retaining and leading top engineering talent
The ability to set a high bar for your team and empower them to achieve great results
A “driver” personality - constantly pushing toward clarity, improvements and delivery while balancing the need for great collaboration
Experience with ITIL practices.
Master’s Degree in computer science, computer science engineering, or commensurate experience required
Technical understanding must go from the highest abstractions down to the metal
Solid understanding of TPF, Java, JavaScript or any other programming language.
Solid understanding of networking and systems engineering.
Strong organization and prioritization skills along with outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Servant Leadership and strong followership mindset.

American Express is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative Commercial data products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team!
 
This Technology Project Managers that join our Commercial Data Engineering (CDE) team can be assigned to one of several exciting teams team that are developing Commercial data products that are targeted across American express internal  platforms and external Clients that will span over 100+ international markets.
Member of the CDE reporting to an Engineering Director.
 
You will be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team responsible for delivering world-class cardmember experiences across multiple channels, and may include Bigdata, web, social integration, , and APIs technologies. You will be challenged with identifying innovative ideas and proof of concept to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers.

Key Responsibilities

Commercial Data Engineering platforms support the data products, Corporate statements, reports, regulatory and compliance needs with high stability and availability.  The transformation will drive efficiency and improvements in agility, cost, innovation and time to market.
As the Technology Manager , you'll be working in scrum format with Global Commercial Organization to prioritize backlog, write features, user stories and collaborate to deliver on the same.  
You'll closely work with business partners to articulate outcomes and expectations, tie initiatives to key metrics, and drive consensus around Minimum Viable Product (MVP) definitions. You'll work with execution teams to ensure delivery of consistently high-quality, timely software products
You'll weigh initiatives against opportunity costs, feasibility, and product roadmaps.
A key part of this role will be to build and foster a culture of agility and product ownership in close partnership with technology and business teams.
Establish a robust software product strategy using inputs from market research as well as analysis from internal stakeholders such as marketing, compliance, architecture etc.
Deep engagement and consultation with various business teams to understand current and future needs
Build robust understanding of Commercial Data domain as well as competitive landscape
Build and actively manage a product backlog of features and capabilities that are groomed and prioritized in close collaboration with the business teams
Manage work allocation of scrum teams by translating features into prioritized user stories and also by tight coordination with other Product Owners
Focus on enabling systematic controls, proactive monitoring and business facing dashboards along with process automation.
Full participation in and support of agile practices and ceremonies to reinforce the agile transformation of the delivery team
Communicate and build consensus across multiple teams in creating solutions to business needs
Please note, Salary increases in case of a lateral move are provided only on an exception basis and in line with compensation guidelines.
Qualifications


5+ years’ experience in Software Product Management with proven track record in defining winning product constructs and delivering a product roadmap OR
10+ years’ experience in process and project management with in depth understanding of end to end Commercial products and  process and underlying financial impacts 
Hands on experience in building a distributed technology stack as well as transition from mainframe to distributed
Team skills, including ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with all levels within organization, internally and externally
Proven experience with agile and scrum software development methodologies
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to consult with various stakeholders and drive to optimal requirements
Problem solving, organizational and analytical skills
Project management skills; ability to prioritize and complete tasks
Familiarity with one or more programming languages and Bigdata is desirable
Knowledge of financial services industry and associated products is desirable

Managing daily case inventory to exceed Case Resolution Time targets to benefit both the business area and the Merchant

You will also be required to liaise with our Partners/Terminal Owners in order to resolve various POS issues
As well as resolving Technical issues, the successful candidate will be able to reinforce the American Express Premium Value Proposition, enforcing the mutually beneficial relationship with our Merchants, adding value in each interaction by highlighting competitive pricing and speed of pay structure, and ensuring our Merchants understand the value of acceptance. You will also be dealing with escalations from Internal Customers, via calls that have been received into our Telephone Service Centre or via Sales/CLM teams
Continuous process improvement by identifying and driving down bad demand/increasing initialisation rates

Management and administration of the marketing budget for brand & advertising campaigns, including end-to-end supplier payment and internal reconciliation

Don’t just work for a market leading global company. Help grow one.
 
American Express’ Referral Programme taps into the passion that our Cardmembers have for the brand and turns it into an acquisition opportunity. Through the programme, consumers and small businesses can recommend their friends, family and colleagues – It engages our Cardmembers, allowing them to unlock true value for their friends with unique enriched offers, while earning rewards for themselves.
 
At the heart of our referral programme, is a personalised referral link, which is unique to each Cardmember. It is integrated into the Refer a Friend microsite, the American Express Mobile App and other Customer touchpoints, enabling Cardmembers to share the referral link seamlessly through a variety of options. Referral Marketing is the fastest growing card acquisition channel for American Express globally and will continue the growth trajectory in 2018, given the strong underlying economics, relative under-penetration of the Cardmember base and significant appetite for investment.
 
This position will report into the Director, Referral Marketing and is critical to the programme’s ambitions of accelerating growth by spearheading new launches – Markets, Products and Communication touch-points. Additionally, the successful candidate would lead Bonusing Excellence, including the design of new flexible and experiential bonusing constructs. 
 
Responsibilities


Lead launch of new markets, products and communication touch points
Provide thought leadership on evolution of the bonusing constructs, including Spend Accelerators, Gift Cards, Experiential Rewards, etc.
Partner with markets, Technology teams and other key business partners Rewards and Operations teams to enhance core bonusing capabilities
Lead evolution and implementation of Referral Marketing related Gaming and Self Referrals controls.
Partner with Technology teams in an agile environment to translate wider business objectives and ensure product delivery per roadmap
Partner with digital acquisition leads across markets to support and ensure prioritization of Referral Marketing deployment
Define and develop user stories to support new product capabilities and attend agile planning ceremonies.
Partner with analytics to set-up tests, end-to-end tracking and reporting

 
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
Qualifications

Required skills:


Experienced Product Owner, well versed with user story creation, backlog grooming, sprint planning etc.
Experience of collaborating with Technology partners, working as a core member of an Agile team and strong knowledge of Agile tools and methodologies
Strong technical experience in developing both back-end and front-end capabilities.
Strong understanding of lean hypothesis testing techniques for quick, iterative designs
Superior relationship building and management skills, strong experience in influencing without authority with key internal and external stakeholders and partners at a local and international level
Highly collaborative, values strong team dynamics and is proactive in supporting market partners
Exceptional problem solving skills to find solutions to challenges or barriers in ambiguous environments
Proven track record of driving results within digital space; takes personal accountability for achieving individual and shared acquisition goals
Exceptional analytical skills and ability to interpret various data to drive strategy and innovation
Strong knowledge and/or experience in developing and managing referral programs a plus.

Job Title: Manager, MGM Product Development (12 month FTC)
Location:
Multiple 
Burgess Hill, United Kingdom; London, United Kingdom; Brighton, United Kingdom

Description:
American Express is a global services company and the world’s largest card issuer. Our direct relationships with many millions of consumers, businesses and merchants worldwide - combined with our leading edge marketing, information management and rewards capabilities - enable us to offer an array of valuable services that enrich lives, build business success, encourage financial responsibility and create communities of people with common interests. American Express for 9th consecutive year has been voted among India’s top 10 workplaces by the Great Place to Work institute. In recognition of our consistent performance, we were nominated to the Great Place to Work “Hall of Fame”. At American Express, we serve customers, not transactions. We’re widely known for providing superior customer service and have been recognized for a number of achievements including being ranked highest in customer satisfaction within the credit card industry by J.D. Power for seven consecutive years. A career at American Express is rich in experience and offers opportunities to build lasting relationships with our customers. Come join us and realize your potential. Global Commercial Payments (GCP) provides a range of card programs, lending solutions and expense management tools to help companies around the world manage almost all the facets of their business spending - from travel and meetings, to everyday office supplies and raw materials. These solutions deliver a number of benefits to our customers including increased visibility into their business spending, added control, improved efficiency and cost savings. GCP continues to be a fast growing business. Accelerating growth momentum, increasing profitability, and powering up our value proposition are key objectives for GCP organization. The Global Product Development & Operational Excellence (GPD & OPS) organization, within GCP, is instrumental in ensuring achievement of these objectives. The DS&I is part of the GPD & OPS organization. It is the analytical engine that powers profitable business growth through consultative and innovative solutions across GCP. The listed job is an exciting opportunity for supporting the Global Product Development & Operational Excellence organization and be a part of Customer Analytics in DS&I. This role would be responsible for supporting the India GCP business. The role will lead the design, development and implementation of advanced analytical insights for consumption by client-side administrators as well as C-suite decision-makers. The insights will be typically on the Travel & Entertainment and B2B spend of these clients. The candidate will be responsible to provide best-in-class analytics to facilitate well-informed and effective decision making. Beyond the primary role this position requires the ability to drive strategic thought leadership on a wide-range of business priorities, lead and coach colleagues on how to deliver impactful insights, identify and promote global consistency & synergies where necessary. Key Responsibilities include: • Ensuring a close collaboration & partnership with market sales and AD teams • Delivering data-driven insights using statistical analytics techniques to stakeholders to uncover trends and underlying drivers of growth and profitability to inform business strategy • Create customer clusters through sophisticated segmentation and deploy customized solutions / product recommendations. Modeling experience will be a key requisite. • Closely collaborate with business partners to maximize the business value of solutions with innovative platform and intelligence enhancements • Driving ongoing process improvements to reduce cycle time, increase accuracy and improve transparency • Partnering with numerous regional teams to drive innovation, best practices and global synergies Strong business and financial acumen, with solid quantitative skills and creativity in developing insightful analytics. Credit card analytics experience preferred. Requirements • Excellent communication, presentation, influencing and partnering skills • Strong process management orientation with a proven ability to drive results across multiple projects simultaneously in a fast paced and highly matrixed environment • Ability to make complex prioritization trade-offs and tactical decisions using sound business judgment, analytical and reasoning skills • Knowledge of the art analytics and Business Intelligence tools • Strong relationship management and team orientation; ability to lead and influence others in a cross-functional environment • Strategic thinker who can partner with key stakeholders to drive the direction of the business • 3-4 years of relevant work experience • Hands on with SQL, VBA and knowledge of R/Python will be preferred QualificationsQualifications: 
• Bachelors in quantitative field (e.g., Bachelors in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics, Operations Research), M.S or MBA. 
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Don’t just have a great idea, build it.

We’re looking for Server side API Engineers to work on Mobile application Service Layer that will be used by tens of millions of American Express cardholders around the world. We want someone with strong technical skills and creativity. Should enjoy solving tough problems and working with new technologies.
 
You should not be shy about sharing your ideas, and be obsessive about user experience and beautiful code. You’ll be part of the Mobile Engineering team whose mandate is to develop new products and platforms for American Express customers. 
 
Mobile Engineering’s aim is to build interactive experiences at all touch points of a consumer's journey whether before, at, or after the time of purchase. You’ll be working in a fast-paced environment with the stability of working for a Fortune 100 company. Your primary responsibilities will be to work on a small team of engineers developing mobile products. You should be familiar with modern software development methodologies, and be able to dive deep and rapidly iterate on ideas despite ambiguity. 
 
The Mobile Engineering team will grow significantly in a very short time period and to assist this growth we are actively looking for an Engineering Director to manage the whole division, Software Managers, iOS engineers as well as Android Engineers.
 
Responsibilities:


Contribute to the design, architecture, and development of Sever side APIs that are elegant, efficient, secure, highly available, and maintainable
Works closely with other developers (within the team and outside the team), and product owners to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfaction
Contribute insights into ways to improve our processes and tools
Be highly motivated and maintain a positive, “can-do” attitude in a fast moving environment
Follow and help cultivate consistent development best practices
Collaborates with project manager and other software developers to plan, design, develop, test, and maintain the Server side APIs
Provides thought-leadership regarding implementation best practices
Assists in estimation and assessment of feasibility of features
Foster a collaborative spirit across multiple teams



Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.








Qualifications

Required skills:

University degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems Technology or related field.

·        Oversee the coordination and delivery of marketing forecasts/plans across the Marketing team. Partner closely with the Finance team to ensure timely and accurate forecast submissions
·       Scope to take on additional marketing projects in collaboration with the broader team.
·        Produce analysis, reports and forecasts for new and existing marketing opportunities.

Function Description: 
International Commercial Card Lending is a critical position on the Global Commercial Services (GCS) Risk Management team and is responsible for driving profitable growth for GCSPurpose of the Role :
This position will play a key role in supporting the growth goal and helping to launch multiple lending products across markets. The incumbent will be responsible for managing credit line underwriting and feature cap underwriting as well as designing, building, and enhancing line strategies, capabilities and processes to manage and monitor risk prudently across the customer lifecycle as it relates to small business proprietary and co-branded credit cards. This position requires close partnership with Product, Marketing, Operations, Technologies, Finance and other functional risk teams to develop lending growth strategies that serve our small business customers’ needs while minimizing credit losses
Responsibilities:
• Manage core credit limit underwriting decisions and related functions, including; prospect initial line, customer initial line, proactive line increase, reactive line increase and line reallocation• Manage risk across line decisions through quantitative analysis and building efficient business processes and flexible capabilities• Identify new opportunities to support credit line underwriting for small businesses while continuing to enhance existing underwriting decisions by incorporating new information, techniques, and change factors• Partner across Risk Management and with Product, Marketing, Finance, and Operations teams to design and implement lending strategies that enable profitable growth while controlling for through-the-cycle volatility• Drive in-depth analytics and collaborate with the Decision Science team to enhance economic logic that supports core risk management decisions• Build and deploy the next generation of risk management tools and capabilities to deliver industry-leading credit quality and to enable accelerated profitable growth
 
Critical Factors to Success: Business Outcomes: • Drive billing, revenue growth and profitability through advanced analytical techniques • Maximize business returns by institutionalizing efficient and accurate models. Leadership Outcomes: • Put enterprise thinking first, connect the role’s agenda to enterprise priorities and balance the needs of customers, partners, colleagues & shareholders. • Lead with an external perspective, challenge status quo and bring continuous innovation to our existing offerings • Demonstrate learning agility, make decisions quickly and with the highest level of integrity

Growing consumer lending, through winning share from our customers and the enhancement of our existing lending products, are top priorities as American Express mobilizes to capitalize on key growth opportunities over the moderate term.  The Global Consumer Lending (GCL) organization exists to evolve our portfolio and approach with the aim to transform the way we meet borrowing needs in an ever changing landscape.  
 
Since the early 1960s, providing Cardmembers flexibility to pay charges over time has been a key feature of the American Express Premium Cards.  Today, Pay Over Time one of the largest consumer lending portfolio and is a critical driver of profitability.  Pay Over Time features provides American Express’ Cardmembers a critical tool to manage their account while enhancing the flexibility of the core Charge product.
 
This role within the GCL Pay Over Time product organization will be responsible for end-to end ownership of product development from ideation to execution.  Operating in a lean, fast paced environment, this role will be expected to manage multiple project priorities and drive flawless execution to support business growth.
 
Primary responsibilities include: 

Design of product development strategy and leadership of product development work streams for phased launches and on-going product enhancements 
Managing the near and long term roadmap for the product  working with cross-functional stakeholders including but not limited to Premium Products, Technology, Marketing, Customer Experience, Finance, Risk, Pricing, GCO, Compliance and others 
Crafting detailed user stories, managing product backlog, prioritizing features and working with engineers to groom, sprint plan, and install new features 
Monitoring results & feedback post launch to refine features and iterate 
Establishing an Agile product development culture in the team QualificationsExceptionally strong project management and results driven mindset with a proven ability to deliver against multiple priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Ability to perceive, assess and solve stakeholder requirements and adapt quickly to changing needs and priorities
Strong interpersonal, relationship, and influence management skills that allow for close partnerships with many different constituents 
Strong communicator with an ability to establish good working relationships with partners of all levels and with competing priorities
Knowledge of Agile Lean Startup and Product Development processesEmployment

Job Title: Sr Manager Product Development Pay Over Time

Description:
Prospect Acquisition is one of the largest investments in Global Consumer Services Group (GCSG) and Enterprise Digital Analytics (EDA) team creates central, scalable marketing solutions and analytics capabilities to accelerate growth in many core business areas including Digital Acquisitions. 
 
This role in EDA will be responsible for analytics and digital targeting to support GCSG in meeting the prospect acquisition goals. Working in close partnership with Global Channel Marketing, Product and Lending teams, the incumbent is expected to design and implement effective acquisition strategies across our global Affiliate and Cobrand partnerships. The incumbent is expected to advance data driven precision marketing techniques using world class analytics and data science, in collaborating across a variety of teams including Marketing, Capabilities, Technologies and vendors to drive results and help American Express achieve its acquisition goals with improved efficiency and quality.
 
Job Responsibilities: 

Designing targeting, segmentation logic, test and learn design, campaign execution & analytics for digital acquisition channels
Leveraging digital data to expand precision marketing to ensure best in class customer experience and maximum value from acquisitions
Analyzing performance of current initiatives and present findings and solutions to senior leadership. Publish monthly MIS and deep dive into changes in trends 
Working in close collaboration with capability teams to identify and evaluate new data sources and develop new channel integrations
Create convincing business cases highlighting opportunities to implement innovative targeting solutions across partners and channels; infuse marketing strategy with data driven approach 
 
The role requires a passion for digital marketing with a particular focus on constantly evolving Affiliate landscape. The ideal candidate will have a balanced quantitative and qualitative marketing skill set. Additionally, candidates must have excellent interpersonal and communication skills and proven experience working with cross-functional teamsQualifications
Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree is highly preferred
1-2 years analytics professional experience is highly preferred
Strong ability to drive results; self-starter
Expertise in application of analytics (applied statistics/quantitative methods) for solving business problems. Exposure to digital data and web analytics is a plus
Prior programming experience in SAS, SQL and/or Hive. Understanding of web tracking data and related technologies (Java, HTML) is a plus
Proven ability to analyze large and unstructured data sets
Ability to multi-task, operate effectively under changing conditions and rigorously prioritize initiatives based on business objectives

Description: This is an exciting opportunity to join the Digital Servicing Interaction Capabilities team within the Global Services Group.The Digital Servicing Interaction Capabilities team continues to lead and grow AXP’s digital servicing and engagement footprint in the U.S. and International Markets with the Live Chat, Co-Browse, Email and Social Media products.  Future plans include additional product optimizations and integrations to improve customer experience while we continue to expand globally across the Customer Engagement Network (CEN), Merchant, Travel and Corporate Program Administrator lines of business. A Business Analyst will support the Live Chat Product Team with the analysis, definition and integration of new capabilities and services into our deployments, as well as leading the management and resolution of production issues and improvements to customer experience.  This role will be instrumental in developing new capabilities to support our strategic roadmap, enabling us to meet quickly evolving customer needs.  The ability to understand the current product architecture and identify improvements will be important to assist the seamless deployment of Customer Experience initiatives. Collaboration is critical for this role, as Live Chat doesn't exist in isolation, rather it is a component of an omni-channel digital experience for our customers, managed by several product teams. This is a unique role with an opportunity to become part of a dynamic team, driving digital engagement in a continuously evolving space. You will have the opportunity to propose innovative ideas that deliver Relationship Care® through every interaction with internal and external customers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. You will lead Enterprise Cloud Security Architecture working with cross-functional and cross-enterprise teams that define requirements (business and technical), develop architecture specifications, assess and select vendors/products, pilot new technology elements and process, develop enterprise-scale deployment plans and lead initial implementations. The role will work closely with other Information Security departments, architecture and development teams, and external cloud providers on requirements, design, integration and delivery of these solutions.
 
Responsibilities

Provide senior security architectural leadership to all phases of the Cloud Program, including the Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Cloud Application Architecture subprograms.
Work closely with subject matter experts to develop and deliver a complete security architecture solution
Lead technical analysis and recommendations (e.g. evaluate and select vendor security products based on functional, security and operational requirements; review and comment on security architecture)
Lead technical design and first instance deployment of global projects including security solutions for internal and external IaaS and PaaS clouds (e.g. collaborate with risk analysts, project managers and technical subject matter experts to design, plan and implement enterprise security solutions spanning the endpoint, network and application space)
Produce (contribute to and oversee others) high quality documentation (e.g. Architecture Specifications, System Requirements, Roadmaps, White Papers) to accurately capture and communicate business drivers, technical requirements, system design, and future plans and provide thought leadership at the enterprise level).
Present cloud security architectural design concepts and solutions to all levels in the organization
Build cloud optimized architecture patterns and contribute to Enterprise Architecture governance.
Compare and evaluate various private, public cloud technologies and tools from technical, functional and financial feasibility.
Drive proof of concepts that assess the feasibility of solutions and demonstrate to our product partners how technology can be leveraged.
Gather requirements; build functional specifications, timelines, adoption plans and other artifacts to support security implementation.
Work with stakeholders within and across Business Unit teams to collaborate, enable, and drive decision making.

You won’t just shape the world of software.

So if you’re interested in a career creating breakthrough software and making an impact on an audience of millions, look no further.
 
You won’t just keep up, you’ll break new ground.

Taking your place as a core member of an agile team driving the latest development practices

Write components in Big Data with Spark, Hive, HBASE, Data transformations as well as REST APIs, Streaming & Batch Processing

Description:
At American Express we recognize that our most valuable asset is our people.  After all, it’s our people who deliver an excellent service to our customers all around the world, and it’s our people who therefore drive our ambition to become the world’s most respected service brand. You will be given continuous coaching and feedback in your work, to get the best chances to succeed in your role. You will be developing into a professional role as well as personally grow in our international and exciting Company.
 
Why Risk Management?
 
Risk management decisions have a significant impact on the profitability of the business. That’s why we don’t guess, we trust the data, insight, analytics and abilities of the risk management team. We believe that knowing the risks is how you’ll make the right decisions for the future of our company and your career.
 
What will you do? 
 
This is a Manager role reporting into the Chief Credit Officer of the Nordics. 
You will be responsible for managing the Net Loss Provision by ensuring effective execution of strategies and policies for the consumer card businesses in the Nordics. 
This will require a good understanding drivers of the credit indicators for the consumer portfolio and the implications on trends/forecast and monitoring the true experience of customers in the market, diagnosing problems and identifying opportunities for improvement and then working with partners to implement.
 
As a key member of our Risk Management team, you will work closely with risk colleagues across the globe to learn and deploy best practices from other regions. You will implement risk-driven strategies to profitably grow billed business, reduce unnecessary point of sale disruptions and improve the customer experience in close collaboration with central Risk teams that develop state of art decision science tools and risk capabilities. You will also work collaboratively with business partners such as digital acquisition, engagement, business development, operations, compliance etc. Given the strong business focus on digital, you’ll be working at the forefront of digital innovation to realize new strategies that drive customer acquisition and engagement.
 
This is both an exciting and rewarding role that offers a unique opportunity to gain experience across the credit risk life cycle and to interact with a wide range of business partners across all levels within the organization.
 

Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
Qualifications
Advanced degree in business, finance, statistics, economics or mathematics or equivalent experience in a similar business is preferred
Deep understanding/experience of risk management principles
Experience in unsecured consumer lending or in the payments industry
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with strong thought leadership and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Self-starter with an ability to work in a dynamic, fast changing environment, with a strong attention to detail, communicate effectively and work well in a cross-functional environment
Demonstrated interpersonal skills and able to work effectively in a matrix environment
Experience in developing strategic insights leveraging data analytics will be preferred
Experience in either SAS, SQL, Matlab,  Python or similar is required
Fluency in Swedish and English is required

American Express offers an amazing opportunity for an engineering expert to lead the development of Marketing Execution, Sales and Client Management functions in support of Global Marketing, Merchant and Network organizations, as a part of Enterprise Platforms – Salesforce organization.  Enterprise Platforms is an organization whose core purpose is to transform, the platform solution-delivery model for American Express, dramatically improving our product and engineering effectiveness, strategic agility and speed to market to deliver world class platforms for our customers. Enterprise Platforms – Salesforce organization is responsible for creating solutions on Salesforce platform by harnessing the power of Data, AI/Machine Learning, and Robotic Process Automation (RPA) to offer powerful selling and re-selling engines to acquire new clients and expand existing client relationships for our Sales, CRM, and Marketing colleagues across the Enterprise.
 
We are looking for a passionate and experienced engineering leader who will drive the vision, strategy and innovation of the Marketing Execution and Merchant Sales platform to ensure it meets the evolving needs of our Sales and Marketing colleagues and the industry.  You will have plenty of opportunities to make your mark on the global solutions that you will create leveraging Salesforce platform. Create vision and roadmap to leapfrog into the future with the support of digital capabilities, Data, AI/Machine Learning, and Robotic Process Automation (RPA) to provide unique experience to thousands of our Sales and Marketing colleagues. This is an excellent opportunity to fast-track a fulfilling career as an engineering leader – with excellent rewards and benefits – at American Express
 


Responsibilities:

As a Vice President in American Express’ Technology organization you will need to have substantial experience in developing large scale and enterprise-grade distributed systems, software engineering and operations.
•                 Own the end-to-end platform architecture & engineering of AXP’s global Marketing Execution, Sales and Client servicing capabilities.
•                 Drive the platform transformation, and the associated engineering culture, tools, processes and frameworks.
•                 Recruit, retain and lead the best engineering talent that will help advance our software engineering practices while accelerating the Sales and Marketing Digital transformation journey. 
•                 Lead scrum teams, sprints and releases – including feature planning, backlog prioritization, stakeholder management, defining technical OKRs, continuous improvement in velocity & productivity and issue management. 
•                 Lead design thinking exercises to identify new ideas, methods and approaches for modern software development; includes simplification and reengineering opportunities.
•                 Collaborate across engineering, product and Salesforce platform shared services teams to accelerate implementation through use of OKR’s, designing lean processes, tech industry best practices and a continuous platform blueprint.
•                 Build a diverse and inclusive team and culture that is customer centric, data driven, agile and innovative.
 
 The successful candidate will possess the following characteristics:

Industry recognized Salesforce platform, Data and digital technology engineering prowess.
Transformative and innovative leader who is a proven catalyst for change.
Customer-centric, Proactive, Flexible & Outcome-focused.
Qualifications
  15+ years software development experience with a demonstrable track record of building technically demanding platforms
        5+ years developing various Salesforce cloud platform solutions, modernizing Salesforce implementations using Lightning, DX, Einstein and integrating with other enterprise platforms at scale
         5+ years proven leadership experience of large, fast-paced and dynamic engineering teams
        Deep experience in one or more of the following technologies: Salesforce Apex, Salesforce Lightning, JavaScript (Node.js, React, etc.), Java, Python, Kafka, etc.
        Extensive and recent hands-on experience engineering and successfully implementing complex, large scale, enterprise software products and cloud native platforms.
        Recent hands-on experience in the development of enterprise-grade API(s).
        Recent experience with agile development methodologies.
        Recent hand-on experience with modern software engineering concepts (e.g. CI/CD, DevOps, rapid prototyping, test automation, containers, microservices, etc.).
         Maturity managing complex platforms that require a deep understanding of application logic and dependencies
        Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to flip seamlessly between customer, executive stakeholder and engineering dialogs.
        Proven ability to influence at all levels of a matrixed organization across varying functions
        Ability to establish credibility with engineers quickly
        Capable of motivating people, instilling accountability and achieving results
        BS / MS in Computer Science or Engineering preferred.

Description:
The New Member Acquisition (NMA) organization is part of the Consumer Marketing Services Organization and is responsible for driving card member acquisition for the US Consumer Card business.  
 
The Marketing Campaign Strategy team is responsible for improving the speed and ease of marketing across all prospect, customer, and partner channels within the Consumer Marketing Services Organization. This is an opportunity to join the Marketing Experience Analytics Platform Technology team. Join our team, if you have the desire to tell a story with data, and the talent to seamlessly integrate customer information across physical, digital, mobile, and social media!
As a Scrum Master & Technical Project Manager, you will join a Technology team which creates next-egeneration analytic capabilities for marketers, product teams, and senior leaders. Engage with Product Owner, Business Stakeholders, and delivery team to understand Business needs and identify appropriate solutions

Job Title: Marketing Experience Analytics - Scrum Master & Technical Project Manager

Description:
Enterprise Digital Membership Experience (EDME) is one of the core groups comprising the larger Enterprise Digital and Analytics (EDA) organisation in American Express, focused on creating innovative and unparalleled digital experiences for Cardmembers. Its mission is to make Amex more essential to Cardmembers’ lives through the creation of differentiated experiences across numerous Enterprise digital channels and services: Americanexpress.com, Amex Mobile App, Amex Offers, Email / SMS Marketing etc. 
 
Within EDME, the Global Web Experience team is responsible for the main consumer journeys on Americanexpress.com end –to-end. It leads the development of online experiences that drive Cardmembers’ engagement and deepens their relationship with American Express.
 
The Global Web Experience team is running a programme of initiatives to improve the ‘Guest Experience’ (or public site / non-logged in) environment on Amex.com. One key workstream is to evolve the Enterprise Homepage for 21 markets. To support strategy and delivery, we are recruiting for a contract Product Owner to be based in London alongside the core Guest Experience product team.
 
The new Product Owner will work closely with the Director, Global Web Experience to help shape the strategy and future facing features for the Homepage experience. They will also be responsible for setting up a robust test and learn / optimisation programme alongside their supporting Product Executive and the Customer Experience Optimisation Manager, as well as sync strategy across the other Guest Experience workstreams (UX Content Strategy ; Information Architecture and Navigation).
 
The work on the Homepage is happening at an exciting time within American Express; the roll-out of the new global brand identity, new enterprise content management system (Adobe Experience Manager) and new common design (Design Language System) mean that we are organisationally ready for this large-scale change initiative to happen.
 
Key responsibilities:


Work closely with the Director, Guest Experience and other Homepage team members in London to establish the Homepage strategy, and market implementation plan
Establish and deliver Homepage optimisation roadmap alongside the Customer Experience Optimisation Manager to move needle on homepage performance
Forge strong relationships with Analytics, UX Design, UX Research and CXO resource to ensure a data and insight driven approach is taken to advancing the Homepage – and help establish a robust, always on optimisation programme.
Manage PI planning with our Technology partners and Scrum Team, providing clear plans, prioritisation and direction for each PI
Build good relationships with markets, as well as guide and influence them on the strategy evolution of Homepage
Collaborate and strategize with all Guest Experience Product Owners (IA, Navigation, Content Strategy) to ensure Homepage Strategy is in sync and opportunities to join dots are realised
Support broader SEO, Accessibility, UX and Brand objectives with Homepage evolution

 
This role may be subject to additional background verification checks.
Qualifications

Required skills


Significant experience as Product Owner, ideally in web and with experience of Agile methodologies and working closely with a Scrum team, and related tools (Jira)
Good awareness of SEO & UX Design principles, web standards and accessibility guidelines – WCAG 2.0 & W3C
Experience of managing and motivating teams
Understanding of web analytics fundamentals
Strong organisational skills – detail oriented and ability to juggle and drive results across multiple projects to deadlines
Excellent communication (both written and verbal) – ability to liaise and collaborate with stakeholders, understand needs and influence them towards the right solution
Ability to feel comfortable in a changing environment – able to adapt / flex approach according to needs
Fast learner, with ability to use own initiative and a ‘can do’ attitude towards problem solving and decision making
Ability to flex working across multiple time zones when required

 
Preferred skills


Web product design experience
Working knowledge / experience of digital content management through Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)
