The Engineering Director, TIMS Operations East (Technology Infrastructure Managed Services), works with the VP of Infrastructure Service Reliability Engineering and is accountable for maintaining the highest level of availability for the midrange environment.  This role will partner and work closely with the Director of TIMS Operations West to provide premier midrange infrastructure services to our hosting customers. This combined team will focus on investigating events, circumventing incidents, deploy customer change requests and actively leading availability.

Description:
American Express entered the travel agency business in 1915 and today is one of the world’s largest luxury travel and lifestyle service networks.  The Travel & Lifestyle Services (TLS) business provides exclusive access, differentiated value, extraordinary service, and unrivaled expertise to Card Members seeking leisure or business travel, as well as a variety of lifestyle services. 
 
The Senior Manager Global Brand & Awareness Marketing is an exciting opportunity to join the Global Partnerships and Marketing organization focused on driving Card Member awareness and engagement with key TLS benefits across industry verticals.  The successful candidate will lead overall TLS lead awareness generation efforts, including a global brand positioning exercise, as well as serve as the ambassador for the TLS brand, ensuring relevance of programs and benefits for Card Members globally and building cross-channel awareness of its unique value proposition.
 
Key responsibilities:

Create and evolve TLS communications and branding strategies based on deep understanding of business objectives
Develop and roll-out a refreshed global TLS brand positioning, messaging platform and visual identity that ladders up to the global brand strategy.  This will include a strategy that includes Card Members, suppliers, and internal stakeholders.
Translate customer insights into actionable and holistic brand strategy
Oversee the TLS above the line and brand activation strategies and execution, partnering across TLS and key AXP stakeholders
Support and influence all below-the-line marketing and messaging across TLS, ensuring all assets ladder up to global brand positioning
Identify opportunities to enhance the TLS customer experience and infuse the new TLS brand into all Card Member touchpoints.
Develop and support internal branding reinforcement and education initiatives, including developing relationships with GABM and Card Product teams
Ensure ongoing measurement of awareness generation and consideration metrics among Card Members
 
 Qualifications  

Strong strategic and creative thinker with excellent creative judgment and the ability to translate insights into marketing plans and communications that delivers on business objectives
Strong and enthusiastic self-starter with a track record of delivering strong results
A dedicated team-player with a passion for innovation and a demonstrated ability to evolve in a changing environment
An effective communicator (both oral and written) and influencer, comfortable presenting to different levels of colleagues and leadership
Ability to build strong relationships with internal and external business partners 
Agency experience a plus
5+ years marketing experience
Bachelor’s Degree required, MBA preferred
Passion for travel
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

Description:
American Express Personal Savings is an online direct bank that offers FDIC-insured High-Yield Savings Accounts and Certificates of Deposit directly to consumers. The business has rapidly grown to over $42BN of direct deposits, and the company is investing heavily to grow this critical component of American Express’ strategy to develop stable, diversified sources of funding for the company’s businesses. We are seeking two highly motivated professional to join the Personal Savings Customer Experience (CE) team.  The work location can either be AESC-SLC or Amex Tower WFC. The Customer Experience team is accountable for the end-to-end customer experience and ensuring that the customer is central to every part of our business. In this role, the candidate will support the CE managers in optimizing customers’ experience with Personal Savings, including their online, email, phone and print interactions.  More specific responsibilities include:Creating digital user journey flows to support projects and user interface changesAssist in driving product backlog by developing user stories and wireframes for new or modified digital capabilitiesWork with internal as well as external cross functional teams to drive product life-cycleAssist in launching new digital features and capabilities for the productCreate training materials to support call centers to support the new capability launchPerforming User Acceptance Testing (UAT) for new screens, processes and communications delivered by technologies partnersCreating and approving written and electronic customer communicationsAssist is conducting customer research and usability labsWork with Compliance departments to ensure that our customer interactions and processes are in compliance with all regulatory and internal guidelinesAssist with quantitative analytics of digital customer behavior Qualifications To be effective, the ideal candidate should have at least 5 years of digital experience across marketing, customer experience, Product management and/or digital capabilities. Specifically:Passion for customer experience with customer first mindset, with experience improving digital and other customer interactionsComfort with numbers and experience with web analytics and/or consumer research (Omniture, Google Analytics, Net Promoter Score and Focus Group)Good written and oral communication skillsFamiliarity with compliance processes (Archer, Meridian and/or RASC system experience a plus)Experience using Agile methodology and writing features and user stories (Rally system experience a plus)Creative, innovative, pragmatic and comfortable with ambiguity, change and multiple prioritiesExceptional people skills: assertive yet collaborative to engage and influence othersEmployment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.Why American Express?

Description:
Fondé en 1850, American Express Company est un acteur majeur du voyage d'affaires et premier émetteur de cartes non bancaires. American Express est un groupe international présent dans le voyage et les services financiers au travers de 5 grandes activités : Cartes pour particuliers et petites entreprises, Cartes et solutions pour grandes entreprises, Réseau de commerçants, Change et Voyages d'Affaires (sous forme de JV). Classée 23ème marque internationale (et 1ère marque financière) reconnue pour sa valeur et sa notoriété au classement Interbrand, American Express compte 53 500 collaborateurs à travers le monde dont 700 à la carte en France.
 
Avec plus de 20 langues parlées et une dizaine de nationalités différentes dans ses effectifs, la marque est dotée d’une véritable culture de la Diversité avec une direction dédiée. La mission Diversité d’American Express a entre autres pour vocation de faciliter l’intégration professionnelle de personnes en situation de handicap et se tient à la disposition des candidats pour évoquer avec eux leurs éventuels besoins d’accompagnement.
 
Le Concierge Double Compétence devra donner un Service de Qualité irréprochable afin de répondre précisément aux attentes d’une clientèle haut de gamme, à savoir titulaire de cartes American Express Platinum ou Centurion.

Satisfaire les demandes des clients en délivrant un service personnalisé de très haute qualité en fonction des besoins des titulaires de cartes Platinum ou Centurion sur le Voyage
Conseiller, organiser des voyages VIP, personnels ou professionnels de façon créative
Rechercher, conseiller et gérer les demandes relatives aux réservations de spectacles, restaurants, visites guidées, livraison de fleurs ou autres cadeaux, taxi ou transferts de limousine, baby-sitting organisation de soirées, d’évènements marketing
Gérer les dossiers dans leur intégralité
Informer et conseiller les clients Platinum ou Centurion sur les programmes et bénéfices rattachés à la carte
Promouvoir les offres exclusives mises en place par le service TLB (Travel Benefits)
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
 Qualifications
 
Required skills:

Bac +2 dans le domaine du Tourisme/Voyage complété par une première expérience professionnelle réussie dans une agence de voyage
Connaître les logiciels GDS Voyage ( en priorité SABRE )
Maîtriser les outils bureautiques (Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook…) et Internet
Avoir une bonne culture générale dans le domaine du voyage (géographie/pays/climat, etc…)
Fort intérêt pour le voyage sur mesure et le tourisme haut de gamme
Ouverture d’esprit et créativité
Avoir une bonne culture générale
Fort intérêt pour les Arts, la musique, le sport, le théâtre, etc.
Ouverture d’esprit et créativité : suivre l’actualité culturelle afin d’enrichir sa base de données et sa culture générale
Excellent sens de l’organisation, rigueur (précision dans la transmission d’informations aux clients et aux fournisseurs)
Bonne écoute et adaptabilité
Aisance relationnelle : contacts réguliers avec les clients et les partenaires
Maîtrise de soi, gestion du stress : parer aux éventuels dysfonctionnements, réagir pour prévenir et Répondre au mieux aux besoins du client
Avoir un esprit d’équipe : partage des demandes du client selon les disponibilités et/ou les spécialités de chacun des membres de l’équipe et/ou planning
Dynamique et enthousiaste : avoir le désir de fournir un service exceptionnel au client dont il gardera un excellent souvenir
Ponctualité et disponibilité, flexibilité
Excellent niveau de français à l’oral et à l’écrit
Bilingue Anglais ( écrit et oral )

Don’t just work for a market leading global company. Help grow one.

American Express Global Commercial Services is the leading provider of Corporate Card Programs, Supplier Payments Solutions and other expense management tools that help mid-size companies and large corporations around the world manage almost all the facets of their business spending.
 
Within Global Marketing, The Global Field Enablement (FE) team leads all field go to market communication strategies for our 4,000 global field Sales and Account Development (Account Sales) organization, training, and programs to drive field tool adoption. This includes innovative learning and delivery programs to enable our field to provide a best in class prospect and customer experience as well as creative and engaging communications of critical business content such a new products, services, and tools. As experts in large field team needs and go to market strategies, we partner across the business on internal go to market strategies. 
 
The Manager of Field Enablement, EMEA Training will join a very exciting, collaborative and high visibility team and will be responsible for driving Sales and Account Sales productivity and success by:


Partnering with field teams to understand most critical needs, and be a credible voice for the field
Leading the end to end strategy and project management of innovative and experiential/digital field training programs, with a primary focus on building a best in class training path
Delivering and facilitating select training programs, in strong partnership with the field as well as external vendors to ensure a best in class, modern and engaging training experience across all parameters of training
Being an expert in Sales and Account Sales enablement for EMEA companies
Collaborating very closely with key partners from Marketing, Product, Risk, DS&I and others
Driving digital tool/Salesforce adoption initiatives within the segment, in partnership with the Global Salesforce Adoption and Global Learning COE teams, with a focus on training
Defining and driving key performance indicators to inform and drive success

 
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
Qualifications
Required skills: 


Significant experience in sales enablement, training, marketing, general management, or B2B consulting field sales/account development/support roles
Proven track record developing successful programs to accelerate the performance of large B2B customer facing teams
Outstanding facilitation skills are a must, coupled with a superior ability to take a large audience ‘on a journey’ while presenting
Proven experience leveraging creative tactics and programs to drive the adoption of new digital capabilities by large client/customer facing teams.
Experience collaborating across many functional areas (such as field, marketing, product, risk, operations) to lead the design and delivery of relevant, timely, and engaging large scale digital/virtual/and experiential training programs.
Outstanding business acumen and results orientation.
Proven passion for working with a customer orientation and global mindset.
Strong problem solving skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment and prioritization
Strong communication skills (written and verbal), presenting to senior audiences, stakeholder management, and influencing skills at all levels in an organization.
Ambitious self-starter, with a strong work ethic, intense will-to-win, and demonstrated personal excellence.
Enthusiastic, fun, flexible and demonstrates a willingness to learn!
Fluency in another European language a strong plus
MBA or equivalent experience preferred

Description:
The American Express Risk Management team manages the Company’s Credit, Market and Operational Risk. The team works with each business unit globally, building best-in-class capabilities and processes to manage and monitor risk prudently and profitably. The Risk Management team’s work extends across the customer life cycle, including aiding with product design, identifying profitable prospective customers, defining new account approval criteria, determining effective and efficient cross sell methods and point of sale practices, and setting collections strategies.
Working within our Asia Pacific team, we are pleased to announce the opening for a Merchant Fraud Manager for Japan, Asia Pacific and Australia/New Zealand market (JAPA). 
 The successful candidate will influence Merchants to implement a suite of world class American Express fraud reduction capabilities. These solutions are aimed at reducing fraud and improving Merchant profitability.  The candidate will create and present to merchants a clear and compelling business case that captures both the quantifiable and unquantifiable benefits of employing fraud prevention tools.  The candidate will serve as trusted fraud advisor to the Merchant and as the single point of contact for Global Merchant Services for proactive/reactive fraud risk concerns for a portfolio of Merchants.  The ideal candidate will preferably have had experience working in a consultative sales role. 
 Other responsibilities include: 
•             Managing the process changes and projects associated with implementing fraud tools. Monitoring, analyzing and recommending improvements to increase data quality thereby increasing fraud tool performance.  
•             Partnering with American Express colleagues worldwide to leverage fraud capabilities consistently across all global markets. Be focal contact point for infrastructure in JAPA region around authorization controls and capabilities with regards to proprietary card fraud. 
•             Working closely with the Fraud Risk Management Team, Global Merchant Services, Global Network Business, Global Security and other American Express business units and will represent American Express at fraud industry association conferences.   Qualifications
To be successful,  you will demonstrate the following core skills and competencies:

Excellent relationship management skills with proven ability to forge and sustain complex business relationships 
Strong analytical skills – Experience extracting key business insights from large amounts of data and assembling into a clear and compelling business case presentation. 
Confident presence – Extensive presentation experience required. 
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Exceptional ability to influence decisions – Possess the skill required to navigate a matrixed organization and leverage business partners to successfully achieve business objectives.
Established track record of driving results across multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Strong thought leadership and problem solving skills.
Ability to challenge the status quo and drive innovation.
Flexibility to travel – approximately 10% depending on client needs (regional and/or international)Experience working in consultative sales and/or Risk within a large corporate matrix environment will be considered favourably

And when they’re ready to take on a new career path, we’re right there with them, giving them the guidance and momentum into the best future they envision.Because we believe that the best way to back our customers is to back our people.The powerful backing of American Express.Don’t make a difference without it.Don’t live life without it.Function description : Central Rating and Underwriting (CRU) sits within the Risk and Information Management division and forms the institutional credit risk management function within American Express. The CRU team plays the critical role of assessing and managing the risk of institutional exposures across all business units within American Express, and in all regions globally. Credit exposures are primarily generated through corporate and small business card programs, via merchant service relationships where non-delivery risk exists, and among the securities portfolio held for firm-wide liquidity. CRU JAPA is led from Singapore covering JAPA (Japan, Asia Pacific and Australia), with direct reporting line into Global Head of CRU in Salt Lake City, USA. In addition to determining the internal credit rating which drives the probability of default of each exposure, CRU also calculates the loss given default of these obligors while underwriting card programs. As a bank holding company, American Express must comply with the highest global banking standards set by Basel and implemented by the bank’s primarily regulatory, the Federal Reserve. Job Responsibilities : Managers in CRU are responsible for rating and underwriting credit exposures in their assigned region, industry, and business line. Fundamental analysis incorporates a thorough review of business, financial, industry and country risk coupled with support from internal and external rating model outputs. Assessment includes understanding of the need for credit extension, profitability of the relationship and program structures. CRU managers interact with various constituents across the firm including front office sales, business unit risk partners, and credit administration to perform their critical role. Desired Skills : •	Expertise as a credit and underwriting decision maker, dealing with commercial exposures ranging from SME or middle-market to large, multinational institutions •	Experience in determining appropriate credit capacity, structuring of facilities, and risk mitigation techniques •	Thorough understanding of fundamental financial analysis including the ability to review corporate financial statements to determine the ability of the obligor to honor its credit obligations •	Comfort with Indian accounting standards and forecasting •	Familiarity with quantitative credit models (such as Moody’s RiskCalc)•	Knowledge of analyzing the outputs from credit models, and identifying any rationale for any deviation found•	Knowledge of public agency ratings, and supporting analysis •	Ability to understand current macroeconomic trends, and making respective sound recommendations to improve the PD estimation based on the business cycle •	Experience preparing company-specific and industry-wide credit memorandums •	Strong knowledge of commercial underwriting  in local banks is a must. Individual with approval authority is preferred. •	Excellent judgment in making sound rating and underwriting decisions to maximize profitability and mitigate risk. •	Familiarity with Basel regulations is required, and an understanding of Reserve Bank of India banking regulations is an advantage.This role may be subject to additional background verification checks.QualificationsQualification :•	More than 5 years’ experience in rating and / or underwriting at a leading financial institution. •	Bachelor’s degree from a top tier university and a degree in finance, accounting, economics, or statistics •	Graduate degree with a finance or business emphasis, or Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation, is a plus.ReqID: 19002337Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Feb 6, 2019, 5:09:55 AM

Function Description:
With a focus on digitization, innovation, and analytics, the Enterprise Digital Analytics (EDA) team creates central, scalable platforms and customer experiences to help markets across all of these priorities. Charter is to drive scale for the business, and accelerate innovation for both immediate impact as well as long-term transformation of our business. 
A unique aspect of EDA is the integration of diverse skills across all of its remit. EDA has a very broad range of responsibilities, resulting in a broad range of initiatives around the world. GMS Insights and Analytics team sits within the EDA organization but supports GMS for their advanced analytics needs, partners with GMS Sales Consultants to scope and execute high quality innovative custom consulting engagements. Depending on customer need, the project can vary in size and complexity. This role is responsible for end to end execution of the project engagement from problem definition, data analysis/interpretation to develop the storyline with the insights/recommendations. The team aims to provide best in class analytics to support key GMS priorities by focusing on: • Marketing targeting and segmentation of Small Merchants • Creation of marketing triggers for small merchants • Delivery and innovation on the Business Insights product for the large merchants • Portfolio analysis, insights and reporting for large merchants • Analysis and insights from marketing to AXP merchants • Creation of analytics capabilities to support above business priorities • Development of automation capabilities to deliver merchant analytics at scale
 
Purpose of the Role: Lead the GMS Insights Team for a particular merchant class OR industry • Partner with BI managers in the market and lead the delivery of complex consulting projects • Coach and mentor a team of 3-4 analysts • Bring business domain knowledge, thought leadership and drive innovation Responsibilites: Lead the delivery of consulting projects for a particular merchant class or industry. Overall accountability of all projects delivered by the team Coach and mentor a team of 3-4 analysts and develop them into a high-performing and cohesive unit Bring to bear thought leadership, business knowledge and drive innovation to build nex-gen products Build strong partnership with the in-market BI teams and their leaderships Hands-on leadership and ability to get hands dirty as and when needed 
 
Critical Factors to Success: Strong analytical skills and prior experience in an analytical consulting environment Effective in written and verbal communication with partners located globally Prior team leadership experience preferred Strong project management skills QualificationsTechnical Skills -
Coding is SAS/R/Python
 Past Experience: 3-6 years of relevant experience in analytics domain Preferred: Experience in the merchant/ commercial businessAcademic Background: Bachelor's in Statistics/Mathematics/Economics/ Engineering with relevant experience Preferred: Post Graduation in Statistics/Mathematics/ Economics/Engineering/ManagementFunctional Skills/Capabilities: Analytics & Insights & Targeting R, Python, SAS, SQL, Hive, PySpark Advanced Statistical TechniquesKnowledge of Platforms: • Hadoop • Big Data –Cornerstone • Knowledge or experience on Digital Marketing platformsBehavioral Skills/Capabilities: Enterprise Leadership Behaviors Set The Agenda: Define What Winning Looks Like, Put Enterprise Thinking First, Lead with an External Perspective Bring Others With You: Build the Best Team, Seek & Provide Coaching Feedback, Make Collaboration Essential Do It The Right Way: Communicate Frequently, Candidly & Clearly, Make Decisions Quickly & Effectively, Live the Blue Box Values, Great Leadership Demands Courage ReqID: 19002223Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Feb 6, 2019, 5:00:35 AM

A unique aspect of EDA is the integration of diverse skills across all of its remit. EDA has a very broad range of responsibilities, resulting in a broad range of initiatives around the world. The Digital Acquisition Analytics team has specific responsibility for Social Media and Display Media analytics that support the International Card Business. They are responsible for driving enhanced scale and efficiency of our digital display advertising. This role requires a strong background in digital technology and analytics trends and exceptional quantitative and problem solving skills. Purpose of the Role: Support the International Card Business by leveraging social/display media analytics and digital technologies to drive enhanced scale and efficiency of digital campaigns.Responsibilities: • Help in creating the next generation Enterprise level Prospect data platform which can drive future growth across different marketing channel • Explore, Engage and Drive new Data & Tech partnership in AdTech space • Identify industry proven platforms/techniques/best practices on display advertising as a mean to improve efficiency and/or drive scale of existing efforts • Work with Platform, Channel, Decision science & Tech partners while maintaining the focus on deliverables & timeline • Perform ad-hoc exploratory statistical and data mining analytics • Design, optimize and enhance display advertising campaign • Analyze campaign performance data and coming up with insights and learnings to improve performance • Identify and design A/B, Multivariate (MVT) testing opportunities to figure out newer avenues to improve performance • Present results of complex analytical problems to business partners and the non-technical audience.
 
Critical Factors to Success: Business Outcomes: • Enhance Marketing processes and leverage data insights to improve campaign performance • Realize Business Benefit using below metrics:Process Efficiency and cost optimization New Accounts Acquired (NAA)/Build Business Acquired (BBA)-Vintage (V)/Average Daily Balance Attrition Rates  Leadership Outcomes: • Put enterprise thinking first, connect the role’s agenda to enterprise priorities and balance the needs of customers, partners, colleagues & shareholders. • Lead with an external perspective, challenge status quo and bring continuous innovation to our existing offerings • Demonstrate learning agility, make decisions quickly and with the highest level of integrity • Lead with a digital mindset and deliver the world’s best customer experiences every day 
QualificationsPast Experience: 0-3 years of relevant experience. Preferred: Experience in display analytics ecosystem and social media marketing Academic Background: Bachelors in Statistics/Mathematics/Economics/ Engineering Post Graduate in Statistics/Mathematics/Economics/ Engineering/Management Functional Skills/Capabilities: • Analytics & Insights & Targeting o Hive, Python , SAS, SQL, o Advanced Statistical Techniques o Data mining Techniques • Digital Product Management o A/B testing o Multivariate(MVT) testing o Knowledge of Digital Channels & Products Preferred: o Social & Sentiment Analytics o Display analytics ecosystem and social media marketing Knowledge of Platforms: •Hadoop • Big Data • Cornerstone Behavioral Skills/Capabilities: Enterprise Leadership Behaviors • Set The Agenda: Define What Winning Looks Like, Put Enterprise Thinking First, Lead with an External Perspective • Bring Others With You: Build the Best Team, Seek & Provide Coaching Feedback, Make Collaboration Essential • Do It The Right Way: Communicate Frequently, Candidly & Clearly, Make Decisions Quickly & Effectively, Live the Blue Box Values, Great Leadership Demands Courage ReqID: 19002126Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Feb 6, 2019, 4:37:46 AM

This critical marketing role is responsible for implementing cross-sell and premiumisation initiatives to Card Members in Australia and New Zealand, aimed at growing card volume and billed business across the entire Proprietary Card Services portfolio.Reporting to the Manager, Early Engagement and Internal Acquisition, the role will suit someone who enjoys a diverse, fast-paced, and results-driven environment. Offering a high level of exposure across the business and management of multiple marketing channels, this role requires effective communication and collaboration across multiple local and international teams and stakeholders.Key responsibilities include:Shaping and executing the strategy for Internal Acquisition, including delivering a program of test and learn, enhanced segmentation and targeting, new offer development and always on campaigns for our Additional Cards, Companion Cards, and Upgrades across the consumer product line.Delivering new capabilities to market and backend system process improvement including project management of new functionalityEnd-to-end campaign planning and management across multiple channels – email (automated and campaign), direct mail, owned and paid media (including display and social)User experience testing and customer journey optimisationReporting, campaign analytics, insights and testing (offer and segmentation) across channelsAbility to turn data-driven strategies into tactical plans and drive measurable performance outcomesManagement of agencies in creative development and campaign executionStrong partnership and consultancy across numerous teams including acquisition, product, technologies, operations, central marketing, external vendors and agenciesOffer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

JOB DESCRIPTION:



The fraud analyst position within GFPS is designed to review incoming fraud claims from Card members through Calls or Emails. 
Upon review, a decision is made to either accept the claim from the Card member or reject it for payment of the balance owed and eventually making a contact with the merchant throughhones/ correspondence. 
Either decision results in necessary maintenance to the account to send appropriate correspondence and make financial adjustments to either parties and notate the account. 




Qualifications

QUALIFICATION:




Deliver best in Business Metrics such as RTF, Resolution Rate, Health Of Compliance (Hoc) Results, Quality Performance, etc
Should be familiar with 1FV
Ensure that Internal Policies, procedures, and Compliance Regulations are being followed
Identify Improvement Opportunities, Develop and Drive appropriate actions plans
Ability to analyze and interpret data in a systematic meaningful manner
Proven analytical and problem solving skills with a strong attention to detail
Strong interpersonal, communication and listening skills
Ability to evaluate card members financial and account data to make sound business decision
Demonstrated dependability/self-motivating skills
Change Management Ability
Multi-Tasking - ability to work on several screens/systems at a quick pace.ReqID: 18016807Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Feb 6, 2019, 1:05:53 AM

American Express has a network that connects millions of consumers, merchants and businesses around the globe in a payments and commerce ecosystem that creates value for all its constituents.   Our Global Merchant Services (GMS) Risk Management Team stands behind each of these purchases, thus protecting this network of millions of consumers, merchants and businesses. Our team makes this happen by leveraging advanced machine learning and network algorithms.   The job entails working in a fast-paced and research-focused environment, leveraging large amounts of linked and unstructured data to predict and prevent credit and fraud risk. Responsibilities include developing the next generation risk management solutions and capabilities and effective collection strategies.    This position will interface with key partners including the Acquisition, Relationship Management, World Services, Risk Decision Science, Operational Business Partners and External Agencies in order to create and drive best-in-class strategy to prevent fraud, limit credit losses and enable collections.  The ideal candidate will have experience in applying data analysis and turning them into strategic insights.   Responsibilities: The incumbent will be a data analyst and technology enthusiast to ensure credit and fraud losses are trending to zero.  Develop innovative approaches and algorithms to reduce fraud & credit losses Create and enhance the core risk foundations and design the blueprint of next generation of risk management science & infrastructure Conduct in-depth analysis of both internal and external data sources for the ongoing development of tailored risk mitigation strategies Identify emerging credit loss trends and implement solutions to support profitable growth Partner with Acquisition, Relationship Management, Compliance, Collections, Operations and External Agencies to implement strategiesQualifications

Proficiency in working with large volumes of structured and unstructured data, including text mining and natural language processing
Strong understanding of machine learning techniques and modeling concepts
Proven programming skills and experience in SQL/SAS, object oriented or functional programming languages
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Excellent relationship management and influencing abilities
Superior organizational, time management, and project management skills with demonstrated proficiency in simultaneously managing multiple projects
Experience in merchant acquiring industry or independent sales organizations (ISO) credit risk management is preferred
Bachelor or Master's Degree in quantitative field (e.g. Finance, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science and Economics) or MBA with quantitative background and relevant experience
Additional Details:

Location: 200 Vesey St, New York, NY 10080
Visa Sponsorship: Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.

Description:
Data Insights Engineering team at American Express is a core foundational platform that helps drive decisions that impact our customer experience at American Express.
The platform is leveraged by various teams in the company to drive decisions, and customer experience.
 
Qualifications
Qualifications:
 
·      Deep technical skills in data engineering, statistics, machine learning, or deep learning and a passion for making these methods more rigorous, robust and scalable
·      Strong programming skills in Python or Java preferred
·      Practical experience working with and conducting experiments on large datasets then turning prototypes into production models in one or more domains
·      Experience applying analytical techniques to provide solutions to real business and engineering problems
·      Ability to explain and present analyses and machine learning concepts to a technical audience
 
Description:
·      As part of the Data Science team, drive requirements for structured data formats from a wide variety of data sources 
·      Build data science products across a wide range of digital data streams (Anomaly Detection, Deep Learning, Information Retrieval) 
·      Work with engineering teams to deployed robust, highly available decisioning and alerting pipelines based on your models.
·      Regularly attend key initiative standups, proactively advising on opportunities to apply and the best approach to apply underlying empirically-developed algorithms.
 
Education:
PhD / Masters in Machine learning, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, or related field. Related work experience will be considered.

Seeking a Senior
Product Manager for our Transformation and Financial Management team within the
Converged Infrastructure & Data Center organization. You will build
relationships and work across multiple hosting channels to deliver program
management, service transition, CI-level financial reporting, strategic and
technical leadership, enterprise infrastructure optimization programs, and
Midrange compliance. Influence and collaborate with Technology Partners and
Directors to identify areas of opportunity and risk to our availability and
budgets. We are committed to our diverse workforce goals ensuring equal
opportunities for all our team members. You will be encouraged to devote time
and effort to grow your knowledge and skillset.
What would your responsibilities
be in this role? You will . . . 

Collaborate
     with multiple partners to define Converged Infrastructure strategy, create
     tracking metrics, CBA evaluations, deployment planning, execution, and
     deliver new converged infrastructure capabilities that truly improve the
     overall experience for our customers and teams
Work with
     multiple teams to share ideas, drive storage product recovery, track
     re-engineering, and deliver positive financial outcomes 
Forecast with
     acute accuracy through identifying key delivery landmarks, drive on-time
     achievement of milestones, and share progress in terms of cost, forecast,
     schedule and assessment of risks/issues
Actively
     anticipate risks and ensure appropriate mitigation planning is in place to
     reassure and avoid compromising delivery commitments
Conduct
     meetings that encourages teamwork while driving effective corrective
     actions and prioritizing necessary infrastructure uplifts and process
     enhancements to improve performance and availability
Demonstrate a
     sense of urgency and enthusiasm in developing elite CI services
Utilize and
     define midrange operational standards, requirements and associated
     documentation – ensure all processes are clear and auditable
Partner with
     team to effectively support regulatory efforts (audit and compliance-clear
     and comprehensive audit responses and PRSA testing)
Effectively
     implement plans with cooperative engagement from technical leaders and
     business partners
QualificationsHave you already been working in a midrange or storage environment with regulatory and financial experience? Then this opportunity should be perfect and you are encouraged to apply.5+ years’ experience running midrange systems and/or storageExperience handling product financials and executive reportingAmbitious with strong interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and writtenAbility to present strategies to senior leaders and drive decision-makingConfirmed history influencing and getting results for enterprise-level projectsAptitude to develop and maintain strong working relationships with both internal and external partnersInspires confidence and the ability to handle ambiguity, multiple tasks, shifting priorities and set schedule to meet deliverables (works with a positive attitude, be flexible, and prioritize tasks)Strategic thinker, who is able to combine technical skills with overall business strategy to creatively resolve complex problems in a dynamic environmentAbility to work independently and collaboratively as a member of a teamShows a genuine personal dedication to successfully completing all projects with an ability to learn rapidly and adapt quickly to changing situationsProficient using Microsoft PowerPoint, Project, Excel, Word, and VisioKnowledge of ITIL and Operational Support standard methodologiesAdditional qualifications desired (not required) include SharePoint development, block/file/object storage, audit and complianceBachelors in Computer Science/Management Information Systems or equivalent experience preferred
Employment eligibility to work with American
Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship
for these positions.

ReqID: 19002324Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Feb 5, 2019, 9:35:09 PM

The Global Consumer Lending organization at American Express works to transform the way we meet the borrowing needs of our customers in an evolving landscape. The US Proprietary Lending Product Innovation team sits within Global Consumer Lending and is responsible for launching and growing new lending products.
 
As a member of US Proprietary Lending Product Innovation Team, the Senior Analyst will drive acquisition for the newly launched digital credit score tool and simulator, MyCredit Guide. The tool provides Amex customers and prospects with their credit score, a holistic view of the factors or actions that might impact  credit score and tools to understand it better. 
 
This position will deliver on product strategy, marketing and the end to end customer experience. This includes, but is not limited to, delivering on marketing and product development initiatives in partnership with finance, risk, marketing, tech, legal, and compliance teams. To be successful in this role, the candidate will need to have the ability to work effectively across various stakeholders and demonstrate a high degree of self-motivation and intellectual curiosity.
 
Job Responsibilities:
 
Drive enrollments and usage of MyCredit Guide through new marketing and product development initiatives:
 

Manage product strategy initiatives to identify opportunities for greater engagement
Optimize current digital flow through analytics and drive channel expansion in digital, mobile and external marketing channels
Evolve user experience through competitive research, complaints analysis and feedback from customer service
Own and deliver monthly scorecard across performance metrics
Manage key online enrollment assets, marketing claims and servicing assets 
Support capability enhancement and projects as needed to ensure operational excellence 
Qualifications

2 years in a marketing, product or strategy related role
Ability to analyze data and generate insights
Passion for customer experience 
Proven project management skills and ability to manage multiple work streams simultaneously 
Self-starter – ability to take initiative in problem solving
Ability to learn and understand complex product and backend processes
Strong relationship building skills and ability to collaborate across multiple cross-functional partners
Educational requirement: Bachelor Degree Required
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.ReqID: 18013950Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Feb 5, 2019, 6:50:24 PM
Job Title: Senior Analyst - US Consumer Lending, Product Innovation

Description:
American Express has been in existence for 160 years servicing its customers with integrity, trust, security and quality.  Today, these attributes still form the foundation of our American Express brand.  American Express employees are engaged and have a passion for their work.  Our continued success is solely dependent on the talent that we attract to our organization and the response that our people make to an ever-changing environment.  Every new member of our Global Servicing Network – Credit Team has the opportunity to become a participant and not an observer and by using your unique skills and background you can help us deliver superior products and services to our shareholders, customers and employees.
 
We currently have positions available supporting Global Commercial Credit in our Corporate Client Credit department. The role provides expert level service to major corporations regarding Corporate Card programs, resulting in flawless delivery of World Class customer Service.
Duties may include, but are not limited to: 

Handle high volume inbound/outbound calls on past due accounts 
Customer focus to maintain relationships while mitigating loss to the company
Ability to probe and truly understand reasons for delinquency to offer solutions that support the client and American Express
Negotiate, collect and resolve delinquent accounts
Decrease risk to American Express through account analysis, profitability evaluation, and important credit decisioning, including new account setup, and billing and accurate payment reconciliation 
Serve as liaison between Field Sales and the client to resolve issues at first point of contact
Must be flexible to work any shift during core hours of operation (Monday through Friday 4:55am-5pm). 
Please note: hours will adjust for Daylight Savings to 5:55am to 6pm
 
 Qualifications

Highly consultative self-starter with a minimum 2 years of current collection or sales experience 
Demonstrated analytical skills to assess credit worthiness 
Basic accounting skills required (basic understanding of debits and credits) 
Proven relationship, negotiation and problem-solving skills with internal and external clients and with team members 
Resolve complex issues in an ambiguous environment 
Influence without authority and strong follow through 
A strong will-to-win and the ability to thrive in an incentive and goal oriented environment, superior communication skills, in both positive and negative situations 
Work independently in a structured environment with minimal supervision 
Ability to analyze and assess needs of clients 
Proficient PC skills including experience with MS Office products and Internet navigation 
Applicant must have SDL endorsement

The Strategic Planning Group (SPG) is the Company’s internal consulting division and was formed in 1977 as the Office of Strategic Development. The group was created as an incubator for strategy and as an internal management consulting resource. Today, the group consists of approximately 40 professionals across London and New York, serving all business units globally.
 
SPG serves as partners to key leaders and the executive team within American Express, working on the most critical strategic initiatives and pressing challenges facing the company, and is often at the forefront of new innovations.
 
SPG is also known as a key external talent pipeline for future leaders at American Express. Individuals within the group transition to take on key leadership roles across various business units, armed with the breadth of experience, exposure to senior management and leadership skills developed during their time with SPG.
 
The Manager / Sr Manager of Talent Development will report directly to the VP of Strategic Planning and Chief of Staff to the Chief Strategy Officer at American Express. S/he will be responsible for leading end-to-end recruitment and training efforts for the Strategic Planning Group (SPG) and management of the VP office, as needed. The incumbent will be responsible for a broad range of activities, including efforts to recruit top talent for the SPG organization and managing a robust training curriculum. The incumbent will be a key member of the SPG leadership team and work closely with SPG team members and key business partners.  He/She will possess outstanding thought leadership, strategic thinking, prioritization, project management, communication, and organizational skills.
 
The Manager / Sr Manager of Talent Development will report directly to the VP of Strategic Planning and Chief of Staff to the Chief Strategy Officer at American Express. S/he will be responsible for leading and driving end-to-end Learning & Development and Recruiting efforts for the Strategic Planning Group (SPG) and management of the VP office, as needed. The incumbent will be responsible for a broad range of activities, including building and managing a robust Learning & Development curriculum and leading efforts to recruit and attract top talent for the SPG organization. The incumbent will be a key member of the SPG Leadership Team and work closely with SPG team members and key business partners.  S/he should be a self-starter who possesses outstanding thought-leadership, strategic thinking, prioritization, project management, communication, and organizational skills.  
 
Key Responsibilities include:

Manage recruitment efforts for SPG  across our New York and London offices, including both on-campus and experienced hire recruitment
Lead and manage training curriculum (e.g. consulting skills, payments, leadership and cross-competency trainings) for 40 colleagues, working with internal colleagues as well as external vendors 
Draft impactful and comprehensive team communications relating to recruitment and training efforts and presentations / talking points for key business reviews, executive presentations, and discussions
Manage talent processes driven through the VP office (goal setting, talent reviews, performance management, etc.), liaising with HR
Lead employee engagement and organizational management, partnering with colleagues across the group
Assist with budget and VP office management, as neededQualifications
Knowledge of recruitment, training and change management fundamentals
A self-starter who is highly organized, energetic, curious, extremely detailed oriented and flexible
Strong sense of integrity with ability to handle sensitive issues and maintain complete confidentiality
Outstanding project management and problem-solving skills
Outstanding oral and written communication skills with strong personal presence; utmost discretion and integrity
Excellent relationship and interpersonal skills, including the ability to influence colleagues and challenge the status quo
Ability to learn quickly, work effectively and be willing to take the lead where appropriate
Demonstrated leadership abilities as well as ability to remain calm under pressure and be flexible when faced with changing priorities
Excellent Excel/PowerPoint skills
Bachelor's degree requiredEmployment

Description: American Express is looking for a high performing Analyst/Senior Analyst to support operations for our email marketing channel. This opportunity sits within the Enterprise Marketing Platforms & Solutions (EMPS) organization and specifically on the Global Email Solutions team. The team is responsible for effectively delivering and implementing digital content across the email marketing channel globally.  Reporting to the Senior Manager, Email Strategy and Operations, the successful candidate will support day-to-day campaign operations, collaborating daily with our email vendors, technology team, and internal marketers to deploy accurate email campaigns to the American Express US customer base. Daily responsibilities include reviewing and processing email deployment requests, providing guidance on test plans and strategy, and setting up dynamic content templates. This role provides an opportunity to work in an exciting area of digital marketing and to shape the future of the email channel at American Express.   Key responsibilities: Manage day-to-day campaign operations for all US customer email marketing programs to ensure timely, accurate deployment of campaigns.Process email deployment requests, reviewing campaign details to confirm all items align with email best practices, SLA timelines, channel requirements, etc.Provide support and guidance to Marketing Managers across the organization.Investigate email campaign set up challenges (data file questions, testing strategy, troubleshoot dynamic content integration, etc).Process requests for dynamic content templates for use within emails, uploading to UI and managing template library.Support team on enterprise-wide digital strategy as it relates to the email channel. QualificationsMinimum 2-3 years of digital marketing or marketing operations experience required (email marketing preferred)Project management experience is a plusStrong strategic mindset and customer focusExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills, attention to detail is criticalExcellent communication and collaboration skills, comfortable communicating with both marketing partners and tech partnersEnergetic and self-driven personality with a persistent desire to learn and grow professionallyBachelor's degree requiredEmployment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.ReqID: 19002104Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Feb 5, 2019, 4:48:25 PM

Description
The Membership Rewards Program Effectiveness team sits within the Global Premium Products and Benefits team in the Consumer Services organization and is responsible for delivering effective governance, sustainable economics and reduce friction in core program experiences across channels for the Membership Rewards program. The individual in this role will be a key member of the team responsible for overseeing governance, driving operational excellence and maintaining the program terms and policies of the Membership Rewards program
This is a high visibility role given the critical role of rewards and public nature of the program terms. The incumbent will own and manage all updates to MR program terms & conditions and terms related marketing disclosures. Success will require a strong process orientation and close partnership with other business teams, Operational Risk, Legal/Compliance, AET, Finance and others. The Analyst is additionally responsible for overseeing program governance functions and assisting in the process risk self assessment and testing program for Membership Rewards as well as leading specific projects to enhance the program experience and mitigate regulatory risk, including Corrective Actions and Loss Events. 
General Responsibilities:
• Manage and update MR Program terms & conditions and marketing disclosures
• Coordinate Quarterly Program Governance meeting 
• Maintain project pipeline for program to ensure all stakeholders have been informed and consulted as appropriate
• Oversee MR related Corrective Actions and serve as business lead on priority corrective actions and Loss Events
• Develop expertise on Membership Rewards platforms and business practices across all MR products and serve as a point of contact to all stakeholders related to program quality management and Process Risk Assessment
• Cultivate an “owner’s mentality” – take an active interest in the performance of the business including achievement of financial and quality goals
• Expand responsibilities where possible to support and lead other initiatives relating to the Membership Rewards customer experienceQualificationsA strong process orientation – ability to refine and improve processes during execution •             Bachelors's Degree Business, Management or related fields 
•             Demonstrated success with project management
•             Customer first mindset
•             Familiarity with tech development processes
•             Results-oriented
•             Ability to partner with cross-functional teams and influence decisions
•             Strong interpersonal and leadership skills
•             Team player with ability to work in a fast-paced environment and still have fun 
•             Exceptional oral and written communication skills 
•             Attention to detail 
•             Comfort in adapting to changing environment

Description:
American Express is looking for talented Software Engineers for its high-energy and self driven Agile team to transform its core card platforms and deliver world experiences to its card members across the globe and on any channel of card members choice. We are looking for engineers who are passionate about delivering deliver high quality software with high throughput. 

Have a knack for coming up with creative and innovative solutions and do not hesitate to open up the boundaries? In this role, you will develop new business critical components using modern software development practices and API first mindset using the best tools and technology for the business problem at hand. You will be at the center of most exciting software development happening across the enterprise.
 
Responsibilities of our Software Engineers include:

Analyzing business features and user stories and refining with the Product Owner to appropriately support design and build activities.
Functioning as active member of an Agile team through consistent development practices (tools, common components, and documentation).
Working with Product Owners to prioritize features and manage a list of technical requirements based on industry trends, new technologies, known defects, and issues
Performing all technical development for assigned applications including developing prototypes, writing new code and API's and performing unit and assembly testing of developed software
Conducting integration and performance tests and providing demo of results to technical and product partners
Debugging software components, identifying, fixing and verifying remediation of code defects (own work and the work of others)
Performing peer code reviews, making deliberate short and long term design decisions and keeping constant focus on clearing technical debt items in the backlog 
Enabling the deployment, support, and monitoring of software across test, integration, and production environments
Influence team members with creative changes and improvements by demonstrating risk takingQualificationsRequired skills and experience:

3-6 years of software development experience
2+ years of development experience with Java (minimum Java 7)
Demonstrated experience in Agile development, application design, software development, and testing
Hands-on experience with Spring Boot, Micro-services, Relational and/or NoSQL databases.
Demonstrated experience with object-oriented design and coding with variety of languages and proven ability to understand and use complex data structures and associated components 
Deep understanding of multithreading concepts with experience of developing robust and scalable distributed server side applications and algorithms
Desirable to have experience of writing applications for deployment on cloud environment including OpenShift and Docker containers
Implementation or working experience of Continuous Integration and Continues Delivery using tools and automation capabilities such as JUnit, Mocking, TestNG, Jenkins, Git, Stash and Jira
Should have worked on RESTful API design and implementation.
Strong technical capability with an intense desire to learn new skills and industry trends 
Collaborative work ethics to thrive on peer support and taking pride in of products and capabilities delivered as a team
Ability to balance priorities and break down complex problems to manageable chunks that can be delivered incrementally
Analytical skills and knack of looking for non-obvious solutions
Experience with Event Driven and Reactive Programming is a plus
Experience developing solutions for complex business problems in Payments and/or Financial systems would be an advantage. 
solutions
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Science Engineering, or related field.

American Express is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high performers. Digital Acquisition is a core business process within American Express Technologies, which is accountable for delivery of online card acquisition journeys supporting the Consumer Card business. The capabilities within the Digital Acquisition platform encompass responsively designed web applications, B2B service integrations, and agent-assisted mobile capabilities supporting customer applications for credit/charge card products. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team!
You will be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team responsible for delivering world class experiences. You will be challenged with identifying innovative ideas and proof of concepts to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers. As a Sr Software Engineer the successful candidate will play a key role in the understanding of product owner strategy and collaborate with his/her peers, technology partners, and product owners to translate complex user stories into successful product releases.  
 QualificationsSoftware Development:
·         Serving as a core member of an agile team that drives user story analysis and elaboration, designs and develops software applications, and builds automation tools for testing
·         Performing hands-on software and strategy development, typically spending most of time actually writing code, doing proof of concepts, conducting code reviews, and testing in ongoing sprints
·         Performing ongoing refactoring of code, utilizing visualization and other techniques to fast track concepts, and delivering continuous improvement
·         Developing deep understanding of integrations with other systems and platforms within the supported domains
·         Working with technical product managers contributing to blueprints, and assisting with annual planning of feature sets
·         Identifying exciting opportunities for adopting new technology to solve existing needs and predicting future challenges
·         Work closely with product managers, back-end and other front-end engineers to implement versatile solutions to tricky web development problems 
·         Quickly generate and updating prototypes from UI concepts for testing and team feedback
·         Finalizing prototypes into Web Applications by integrating with back-end services and functionality
·         Embrace emerging standards while promoting best practices in order to push the limits of what a browser can do
Leadership:
·         Demonstrate increased self-reliance to achieve team goals 
·         Influence team members with innovative changes and improvements by challenging status quo and demonstrating risk taking 
·         Be a productivity multiplier for your team by analyzing your work flow and contributing to enable the team to be more effective, productive, and demonstrating faster and stronger results. 
·         Mentor and guide junior team members to success within the team
·         Identifies opportunities to adopt innovative technologies
·         Manage your own time, and work well both independently and as part of a team.
 
This high energy Senior Software Engineer must have: 
·         5+ years of software development experience and preferably a BS or MS degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other technical discipline 
·         Demonstrated experience in Agile development, application design, software development, and testing
·         Expertise with HTML/XHTML, CSS, JavaScript (Angular, React & Node), AJAX, DOM, and GIT
·         Experience in creating and integrating with REST based Web Services.
·         Thorough understanding of JSON, and data structure fundamentals
·         Experience with continuous integration and various testing frameworks (web driver IO, JEST) 
·         Experience with adaptive and responsive development techniques
·         Experience with internationalization and localization
·         A proven hunger to learn new technologies and translate them into working software
·         Ability to effectively communicate to internal and external business partners on solution design
Preferred Additional:
 
·         Experience with Cloud Based application development & deployments
·         Experience with Native / Hybrid app development.
·         Experience with Java based service frameworks.
·         Experience with a broad range of software languages and acquisition technologies

Why American Express?
 
There’s a difference between having a job and making a difference.
 
American Express has been making a difference in people’s lives for over 160 years, backing them in moments big and small, granting access, tools, and resources to take on their biggest challenges and reap the greatest rewards.
 
We’ve also made a difference in the lives of our people, providing a culture of learning and collaboration, and helping them with what they need to succeed and thrive. We have their backs as they grow their skills, conquer new challenges, or even take time to spend with their family or community. And when they’re ready to take on a new career path, we’re right there with them, giving them the guidance and momentum into the best future they envision.
 
Because we believe that the best way to back our customers is to back our people.
 
The powerful backing of American Express.
Don’t make a difference without it.
Don’t live life without it.

Why American Express?
There’s a difference between having a job and making a difference.

American Express has been making a difference in people’s lives for over 160 years, backing them in moments big and small, granting access, tools, and resources to take on their biggest challenges and reap the greatest rewards.

We’ve also made a difference in the lives of our people, providing a culture of learning and collaboration, and helping them with what they need to succeed and thrive. And when they’re ready to take on a new career path, we’re right there with them, giving them the guidance and momentum into the
best future they envision.

Because we believe that the best way to back our customers is to back our people.

The powerful backing of American Express.
Don’t make a difference without it.
Don’t live life without it.
Focus
Main focus is to provide technical expertise, education, and tooling to ensure the highest level of reliability and availability for critical applications. Able to provide consultation and strategic recommendations by quickly assessing and remediating complex availability issues. Responsible for driving automation, efficiencies to increase quality, availability and security. 
Organizational Context
Technical individual contributor integrated with technology and business partners to ensure efficiencies in increasing quality, availability and security to technical platforms. Works individually and with teams to drive reliability goals and objectives across platforms.
Key Responsibilities
Product Development

Enable creation and updating of logging standards to streamline dashboard creation and ensure usability of logging repository
Drive monitoring requirements to ensure business-service level visibility for all support teams
Participate in architectural decisions to ensure software transaction flows are appropriately supported and designed
Is an IT infrastructure Domain Expert and works with Development teams to build standards that drive the highest levels of availability
Provides guidance to software engineers related to design patterns that are resistant to failure
Communicates effectively with Development and Operations teams to align on requirements, driving SDLC requirements, capabilities, and limitations pertinent to delivering highly resilient applications
Automation

Responsible for evaluating and implementing orchestration, automation, and tooling solutions to ensure consistent processes and repetitive tasks are performed with a higher level of accuracy and reduced defects
Build, implement and advise on recovery tooling to apply enterprise standards and/or frameworks
Introduce new and impactful technologies to the production support tool chain that help minimize friction for production releases and support, and to more quickly diagnose and recover from production incidents
Operational Readiness 

Responsible for availability, proactive monitoring / alerting, capacity planning, performance (reducing latency and increasing efficiency) to include testing for technical platforms
Partner with appropriate teams to ensure operational readiness throughout the application lifecycle
Production Support

Ensure application data flows are accurate and up to date with the objective to increase the knowledge base of teams and drive reliability
Facilitates the resolutions of non-application issues (3rd party upstream issues, infrastructure issues, storage, database, network, file transfer etc.)
Scope of Impact/Influence 

Consults with teams to build standards that drive the highest levels of availability
Mentors teams through ongoing development effort
Partner with development teams to carry out SDLC standards
Center of Enablement – coach and advise about the SRE function working with varies teams and provide real-life examples when necessary
Experience 

Bachelor’s Degree in related field preferred; relevant industry experience can substitute
3+ years of engineering and/or architecture experience in a complex environment, such as: large scale web infrastructure or development team
Experience supporting a 24/7 enterprise environment with on-call responsibilities for production support
Broad range of software development and operations experience such as Infrastructure, virtualization, load balancing, containers, JVM’s, web servers, application debugging, queueing technologies, caching technologies, databases (RDBMS and NoSQL), routing and switching, etc.
Experience in high transaction volume OLTP sites or the Financial Services industry is preferred
High-Performing Behaviors

Has an ‘Automation First” mindset – fundamentally will not accept doing things over and over by hand
Combines deep technical expertise, a continuous improvement and automation mindset, and systematic and rational root cause analysis to find opportunities to make things faster and better
Challenges the status quo, finds opportunities to adopt innovative technologies to enable business capabilities, generates creative ideas and solutions to difficult problems
A recognized authority and highly sought-after consultant that is knowledgeable regarding current research and technology in the industry and uses that knowledge to continually improve the function
Highly influential at all levels including peers, leaders and key partners, distilling complex ideas and concepts with clear, structured, easy to understand language
Adapts to change quickly and easily and helps others adjust to changes through effective communication
Knows when to raise decisions and when to make on-the-spot decisions
Knowledge/Skills 

Knowledge of DevOps related practices such as CI/CD, Canary Pushes/ Blue-Green deployments, Software Defined Infrastructure and tools and etc.
Ability to guide and implement the scripting or development of production support tooling that can be leveraged by your team and others.
Understanding of multi-tier application architectures and related development technologies in support of service virtualization and API implementation/support
Ability to write and build code and/or interpret and understand code
Experience with helping drive story/non-functional/functional test planning
Ability to create and update operating procedures on an ongoing basis
Ability to assess logging and understanding value
Knowledge and understanding of the SDLC principles and key controls
Understand problem and incident management processes
Ability to ensure appropriate database technology is recommended based on application of knowledge and the given software needs
Working knowledge of operations to include certificate management, firewall rules, websites, XaaS, load balancer configuration, website virtualizations (VM’s and containers), etc.
Knowledge of financial industry standards and business practices
Large scale application support experience
Deep understanding of *nix technologies, e.g. AIX, RedHat and CentOS
Exposure to web frameworks
Knowledge of configuration management, release automation, and orchestration technologies
Experience working with enterprise applications to include queueing or shared services technologies
Understanding monitoring technologies, focused on logging, time-series or machine-learning products from a product owners’ perspective
Preferred Technical Experience

Strong Linux Administrator
Backend Devs (RESTful API/Schedulers/Data Metrics)
Demonstrated experience with one or many of the below tools or languages
o   Automation Tools


Ansible (Preferred)
Puppet
o   Development Languages


Shell (Bash)
Java
Python
Golang

American Express is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic newly formed Machine Learning team of high performers that is looking to build the next generation platform for democratizing Machine Learning in Amex on the Cloud. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. 
 
As a Senior Engineer in our Machine Learning team you will be responsible for creating and delivering technical solutions and capabilities on the platform to support our entire ML-driven application portfolio across the enterprise. You will be challenged with identifying innovative ideas and proof of concepts to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers. As a Senior Engineer the successful candidate will play a key role in the understanding of product owner strategy and collaborate with peers and technology partners to translate complex user stories into successful product releases. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across through cognitive solutions, this would be the right fit for you! 
 
Your responsibilities would include: 
 

More than 70%+ of the time spent on coding and/or hands-on technical implementation of re-usable frameworks to drive adoption of Machine Learning in the Enterprise 
Leading your own project. Suggest, collect and synthesize requirements. Create an effective roadmap towards the deployment of a production-level machine learning application. 
Architecting, estimating and planning technical solutions to problems 
Implement new, highly scalable platform components and tools leveraging machine learning and deep learning models to solve real-world problems in areas such as Speech Recognition, Natural Language Processing and Time Series predictions 
Actively participate in team and company-wide architecture and engineering discussions and forums 
 
QualificationsTo be successful in the role, the following experience is required: 
 

 At least 5+ years of progressive experience with a broad set of tech stacks, hands-on Machine Learning and Big Data is mandatory as part of the job 
Deep expertise in building scalable Machine Learning powered applications 
Experience with production grade applications preferred. Ideally with an application that leverages Machine Learning to power its decisions 
 Highly motivated, individual contributor who can manage relationships in a cross-functional environment. Proven track record of working with multiple stakeholders 
Experience in creating and managing capabilities and solutions for: 
              Risk Management 
              Marketing Analytics 
              Quantitative Financial Analytics 

Familiarity and experience with Cloud is a plus 
Master of Science or higher in a quantitative discipline, e.g. Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Sciences or similar Bachelor of Science with 5 years of experience in a highly quantitative position 
 High proficiency with the following technologies: 
           Spark, SparkML 
           Python 
           Big Data 
           SQL / noSQL 
           Java 
           Web Frameworks : Flask, Django 
           Git and GitHub 
 

Modeling proficiency: 
          Linear models & descriptive statistics 
          Natural Language Processing 
          Bayesian Inference 
          Decision Tree Models & Boosting 
          Advanced time series forecasting 
          Linear Algebra & Spectral Methods 
          Deep Learning / Tensorflow / Keras 
          Reinforcement Learning 
 

Must have the ability to design or evaluate intrinsic and extrinsic metrics of your model’s performance which are aligned with business goals. 
Performing hands-on software and strategy development, typically spending most of the time actually writing code, doing proof of concepts and conducting code reviews 
Developing deep understanding of integrations with other systems and platforms within the supported domains. 
Working with technical product managers contributing to blueprints, and assisting needs and predicting of feature sets 
Quickly generate and updating prototypes from concept to testing while soliciting feedback 
Finalizing prototypes into functional ML components and deploy on our cloud platform 
Embrace emerging standards and promoting best practices 
 
Leadership Skills: 
 

Demonstrate self-reliance to achieve goals collaboratively 
Must be curious, hardworking and detail-oriented, and motivated by complex analytical problems. 
Thought leadership and innovative thinking 
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
