Description:
Don’t just work for a market leading global company. Help grow one. 

The Senior Manager Working Capital Analytics serves as a senior member of the team who will collaborate with business leaders and partners to develop a compelling vision, strategy and roadmap for the Supplier Payment Acceleration team. This position will be part of a cross-functional team of treasury specialists and data scientists to produce analytics on specific clients’ working capital needs in order to make accurate recommendations on improving liquidity and financial KPIs. 

Responsibilities 


Contrinute to the team working capital strategy and analytics to support sales and client management teams by providing deal and technical consulting for supplier payments
Develop ad-hoc working capital analyses that enhance B2B value proposition with key recommendations for sales, pricing, product and marketing teams
Facilitate engagement with clients by offering working capital insights to support their business goals
Partner with regional Managers to identify B2B sales opportunities delivering entrenchment and revenue growth
Implement strategic initiatives to enable plans for the Supplier Payment Acceleration team
Represent B2B specialists on cross business project teams and working groups: merchant services/product/marketing/pricing/DS&I/risk and others
Support the creation of deal construct blueprints for selling B2B payment solutions across a wide variety of customers and segments
Understand compliance and regulatory changes and ensure the evolution of the B2B value proposition
Manage workload and identifying opportunities to optimize performance and productivity.




Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.









Qualifications

Required Skills:


Experienced in working capital best practices with profound knowledge of balance-sheet and P&L ratio analysis
Experience in multi-dimensional analyses in order to derive commercial insights to support negotiations with clients and go-to-market strategies
Combine numerical and financial abilities as well as well-rounded marketing and strategy mindset to develop winning commercial propositions for B2B payment solutions
Curious and willing to stay up-to-date with market trends, macro-economic information and competitors’ intelligence
Collaborative and able to drive experts communities to ensure fellowship and partnership opportunities
Self-starter, driven and pro-active who can support the development of a new line of business
Extensive engagement with both internal stakeholders - including LM and GCG Sales and Account Development teams - and continuous interactions with Treasurers/CFOs/Procurement and their professional Associations
Well equipped with product management methodologies to contribute to the creation and management of new commercial tools in order to promote innovation
A “customer first”, design thinking mind set
Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage, influence and inspire partners and stakeholders to drive collaboration and alignment
Knowledge of treasury products incuding Credit Facilities and Supply Chain Finance
Comfortable working in a virtual but dynamic, fast changing (and fun!) environment whilst maintaining high standards of personal excellence and ‘can-do’ attitude.

Job Title: Senior Manager - Working Capital Strategy and Analytics

Description:
Do the right thing for our customers, our company and your career.
 
American Express’ Referral Programme taps into the passion that our Cardmembers have for the brand and turns it into an acquisition opportunity. Through the programme, consumers and small businesses can recommend their friends, family and colleagues – It engages our Cardmembers, allowing them to unlock true value for their friends with unique enriched offers, while earning rewards for themselves.
 
At the heart of our referral programme, is a personalised referral link, which is unique to each Cardmember. It is integrated into the Refer a Friend microsite, the American Express Mobile App and other Customer touchpoints, enabling Cardmembers to share the referral link seamlessly through a variety of options. Referral Marketing is the fastest growing card acquisition channel for American Express globally and will continue the growth trajectory in 2018, given the strong underlying economics, relative under-penetration of the Cardmember base and significant appetite for investment.
 
This position will report into the Director, Referral Marketing and would lead the evolution of the Customer and Prospect facing web experiences.
 
The successful candidate would lead an engineering team key to bringing new features and experiences to life in these digital journeys – defining requirements (user stories) and working closely with the Referral Marketing in-house UX team on designs. In addition there is a strong focus on experimentation and optimisation of the sites and their user experiences and so a strong partnership with teams that lead experimentation efforts (Customer Experience Optimisation and Analytics) is required in order to iterate designs, UI and functionality – with an ultimate goal of driving engagement and conversion, and ultimately evolve the product. 
 
The candidate would own the overall product delivery roadmap for these channels, and would need to ensure that innovative ideas can be smoothly converted into tangible delivery, the success of which can be evaluated through clear KPIs.
 
In addition, the candidate will be responsible for the ongoing maintenance and ownership of the product, and also partner with markets on enhancements or changes to existing features/functionality, such as content updates or issue remediation.
 
Responsibilities:


Lead the Platform Excellence team – responsible for the design and build of the Referral customer and prospect facing experiences.
Lead envisioning of new features and use cases which would lay the platform for programme evolution.
Partner with Technology teams in an agile environment to translate business objectives and ensure product delivery per roadmap
Partner with key stakeholders across 15 Global markets to deliver capabilities and ongoing support for the channel
Define and develop user stories to support new product capabilities and attend agile planning ceremonies.
Partner with Customer Experience Optimization and Analytics to set-up tests, end-to-end tracking and reporting

 
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
Qualifications

Required skills:


Experienced Product Owner, well versed with user story creation, backlog grooming, sprint planning etc.
Experience in defining the UX/ UI for digital experiences. Passion for design and UX is highly valued.
Experience of collaborating with Technology partners, working as a core member of an Agile team and strong knowledge of Agile tools and methodologies
Strong technical experience in developing both back-end and front-end capabilities
Superior relationship building and management skills, strong experience in influencing without authority with key internal and external stakeholders and partners at a local and international level
Highly collaborative, values strong team dynamics and is proactive in supporting market partners
Exceptional problem solving skills to find solutions to challenges or barriers in ambiguous environments.
And understanding of ‘test and learn’ experimentation and the ability to use customer data insights to develop hypotheses to drive iterative feature design and behaviour is beneficial, as is experience with Rapid Usability Testing.
Proven track record of driving results within digital space; takes personal accountability for achieving individual and shared acquisition goals
Exceptional analytical skills and ability to interpret various data to drive strategy and innovation
Strong knowledge of, and/or experience in developing and managing referral programs a plus

Job Title: Assistant Manager - Acquisition Marketing, Acquisition & Partnerships, Proprietary Card Services

Description:
Do the right thing for our customers, our company and your career.
 
The core function of the German and Austrian ASG& Authorizations teams is to handle incoming and outgoing calls and provide an excellent first point of contact experience for our Card Members, Merchants and Partners. As a Team member you will specialize in two main functions, Account Protection and Authorization. 
 
As Account Protection Specialist your responsibilities include, but are not limited to: 


Taking incoming and outgoing calls
Verifying charges with our Card members
Developing an understanding of potential fraud risks and taking the necessary steps to forward and highlight relevant information within the organization
Working closely with other departments to ensure a high standard of customer service and the appropriate action to be taken to investigate and were applicable recharge fraudulent charges

 
In your function as Member of the Authorization team you will:


Take inbound calls from our Card members and Merchants
In contact with our Card members, focus on spend enablement and make decisions in regards to allowing for charges
Support Card members with authorization of transactions in circumstances which might not be the norm
Support Merchants with Address verifications
Provide Merchants with Authorization codes for transactions
Support Merchants with Approvals and Cancellations of transactions

Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

Required skills:


Fluent written and spoken German
Able to work under pressure
A team player with excellent communication and analytical skills
High level of integrity
Must be willing to work on shifts. (24x7/ weekends and bank holidays)
Highly service orientated and possesses good spoken and written skills in English
Understand risk management - preferably with risk operations background is advantageous but not essential

spending.

to market strategies, we partner across the business on internal go to market

success by:

Description:
You won’t just shape the world of software.
You’ll shape the world of life, work and play.
 
Our Software Engineers not only understand how technology works, but how that technology intersects with the people who count on it every day. Today, innovative ideas, insight and new perspectives are at the core of how we create a more powerful, personal and fulfilling experience for all our customers. So if you’re interested in a career creating breakthrough software and making an impact on an audience of millions, look no further.
 
You won’t just keep up, you’ll break new ground. 
 
There are hundreds of opportunities to make your mark on technology and life at American Express. Here’s just some of what you’ll be doing: 

Taking your place as a core member of an agile team driving the latest development practices
Writing code and unit tests, working with API specs and automation
Identifying opportunities for adopting new technologies
Leading a team of engineers that delivers knowledge management solutions to businesses worldwide
Experience with React,Redux,Node JS, Graph QL
Experience with Java/J2EE is required with proven expertise in Responsive Web Design, Web 2.0 (HTML5, CSS3 are preferred), JavaScript, JQuery, Dojo, MVC, Spring Framework
5+ years of systems design, development and integration experience in multiple IT disciplines
At least 5 years of previous hands on development and operational support experience including service development experience is required in a high volume, highly available production environment.
Experience with Web Service standards, XML, XSLT, SOAP, SOA Security and Performance Tuning.
Experienced in initial triage, root cause analysis, and escalation procedures in production environments.
Experienced in runtime metrics identification, collection, reporting and communication.


This role may be subject to additional background verification checks.

QualificationsAre you up for the challenge? 

Preferably a BS or MS degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other technical discipline
5+ years of software development experience
Ability to effectively interpret technical and business objectives and challenges and articulate solutions
Willingness to learn new technologies and exploit them to their optimal potential
At the core of Software Engineering
 
Every member of our team must be able to demonstrate the following technical, functional, leadership and business core competencies, including: 

Agile Practices
Porting/Software Configuration
Programming Languages and Frameworks
Business Analysis
Analytical Thinking
Business Product Knowledge
Why American Express 
 
Talk to our people and you’ll find out what we’re really all about. Open, creative, risk-taking, collaborative and innovative are just some of the expressions you’ll hear. It’s our culture that makes American Express an outstanding place to work, and a big part of why we regularly win best workplace awards all over the world. If you’re ready to take on a challenge and make an impact, you owe it to yourself to launch or grow your career here.

You’ll do more than the expected. You’ll do the unexpected. 

Digital Marketing Manager, GMS International Prospect Marketing
 
Global Merchant Services (GMS) Marketing is dedicated to bringing buyers and sellers together and transforming how American Express is welcomed. GMS Marketing is responsible for partnering with GMS markets to drive profitable growth, accelerate merchant acceptance and enhance the value of Amex acceptance to merchants and Card Members at scale. 
 
The Digital Marketing Manager will be part of the newly created International Prospect Marketing team, an innovative new team aimed at supporting a high profile enterprise-wide coverage expansion initiative and fuelling merchant acquisition efforts within LACC, EMEA and JAPA regions. The Manager will assist with delivering on international coverage goals by ensuring prospects are successfully identified, targeted and converted through digital acquisition marketing. 
 
Key responsibilities will include:


Digital Prospect Marketing:

Proactively partner with local markets, central teams and external agencies to define optimal channel strategies that will drive efficient online lead generation at scale across a range of channels;

Paid channels e.g. Paid Search, Social, Display, Email, Partnerships, etc…
Owned channels e.g. Prospect Journey – website & app/enquiry form, SEO, lead nurturing
Take ownership for launching key channels in targeted geographies developing robust market roll-out plans and ensuring activity is compliant, in line with Brand standards and flawlessly executed
Develop and execute channel testing roadmaps driving continuous innovation to grow scale and improve efficiency (e.g. testing creatives, messaging, targeting, channel expansion, journey UX improvements, etc…)
Identify and explore new digital opportunities that will expand scale and improve quality (e.g. new channels, partners, incentives strategy, etc…)
Reporting & Analysis:

Ensure channel and campaign set-ups provide sufficient tracking visibility
Closely monitor performance and undertake thorough analysis to evaluate campaign/test successes
Share key learnings and use insights to fuel further growth and strategy evolution

 
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
Qualifications

Required Skills:


A strong background in digital marketing with experience spanning across channels
A strong customer-first mindset
A passion and track record of driving innovation and creativity, and openly sharing insights and new ideas
Demonstrated success in building and leveraging strong relationships with a wide range of stakeholders and proven ability to influence across functional areas, markets and external agency partners
Strategic mind-set with the ability to deal with ambiguity and changing priorities in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Exhibited success in structuring and implementing processes
Excellent written and oral communication skills, with ability to articulate complex/technical ideas simply
First-rate problem-solving skills, with ability to find ways around obstacles and challenges with a positive attitude
Demonstrated analytical skills and a track record of leveraging data to drive strategy and results
Ability to efficiently prioritise, manage tight deadlines and multiple projects at once whilst maintaining an excellent attention to detail
Merchant and/or B2B experience

We’re looking for a Media Manager with a focus on digital
that has the commercial drive and ambition to bring one of the world’s most

Apply now and hopefully we can hear all about your ideas soon. 
 
About American Express. 
Founded in 1850, American Express is one of the world’s
most recognisable brands. With 55,000 people working across 44 countries, we’re
a global services company connecting millions of consumers and businesses around
the world. Since we are committed to becoming the world’s most respected
service brand, we continually strive to deliver the best possible service to
our customers. 
 
Our Dutch Consumer Marketing team represents all products
and services related to our Cards for consumers. Whether owning a proprietary
card (an American Express Card) or one of our partnership Cards (Flying Blue –
American Express Cards), our card members have access to numerous exclusive
benefits. From access to presales of the biggest artists to free room upgrades
in hotels, we have their back to ensure they can get most out of their
experiences. 
 
About our team. 
We offer our cards online, via telemarketing, direct
sales and partnerships. As Media Manager, you will join our fast-growing online
acquisition team in a role where you will be responsible for acquiring new
Consumer Card members via an omnichannel media approach. You will report to the
Online Marketing Manager and collaborate closely with the other Online
Acquisition colleagues.

Manage media strategy and develop integrated, creative
and impactful media plansand tactics, which deliver business resultsEnsure all media investment is measurable against KPI’s
and utilize media in the most    effective way.Manage the delivery by agency teams and work closely with

test, measure and learn from all activity we are doing.Establish strong relationships with key lead local media
and agency for effective day-to-day management of campaign delivery. Push &
maintain high standard of excellence and agility in the thinking and the
executions.Manage the delivery of periodic post buy reviews,
activity updates, and financial reporting.Take an active role in driving our innovation roadmap.
Including testing how to best connect with our prospects and drive performance
and growth.

annual NIMA budget) to develop your marketing skills or other professional

You know more than the code, you know quality.
 
Our Quality Engineers understand that “good enough” is never enough. They are experts in automation, testing and quality assurance. And they are driven to continuously raise the bar – ensuring that only the highest quality code is released. Because that is what our business and our customers depend on.
If you join our Technology group, you will be become part of one of many exciting teams that are developing new virtual Internet-based payment solutions, customer service portals, online merchant services support and integration, credit management tools or suites of web-based applications for Card Member targeted offers that will span over 20 international markets.
 
Do you see the details and the big picture?
 
Quality doesn’t happen by accident. It takes deep knowledge and a relentless pursuit of perfection. As a Quality Engineer on our team, you’ll:

Work with engineers to drive improvements in code quality via manual and automated testing
Develop test plans, testing resource requirements, and scheduling of testing activity
Execute test cases/scripts, including Systems Integration, Regression, and Performance Testing
Drive development of automation and testing in a CD/CI environment
Identify opportunities to adopt innovative testing technologies and techniques
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.QualificationsAre you up for the test?

Experience in Technology, with an emphasis on QA, and proven ability in writing test cases, running functional, automated, or performance tests, and managing defects
Solid experience in test-driven development, unit testing, functional testing, system integration testing, regression testing, GUI testing, web service testing, and browser compatibility testing
Experience with Agile, other rapid application development methods, and Waterfall SDLC
At the core of Quality Engineering

Every member of our team must be able to demonstrate the following technical, functional, leadership and business core competencies, including:
Agile Practices
Programming/Software Development
SDLC Methodologies and Practices
Analytical Thinking
Industry and Company Knowledge
Problem solving

You’ll do more than the expected. You’ll do the unexpected. 
 
 
American Express Travel & Lifestyle Services (TLS) is global business unit at American Express that delivers consumer travel and lifestyle services and benefits to Card Members. TLS not only drives direct revenue and cost savings but also plays an important role in overall Card product engagement, loyalty and satisfaction.
 
Driving Card Member engagement via online travel bookings is a strategic focus area for growth within TLS. The online travel websites serve as an accompaniment to the offline travel service for our premium Card products and is the primary travel portal for most Card products in 13 international markets. 
 
This exciting position is primarily responsible for both delivering International online travel marketing campaigns and the onsite merchandising plan for our websites across multiple markets to maximise commercial opportunities. The successful candidate must possess extensive knowledge and experience in onsite merchandising & digital marketing, ability to work across multiple sites & multiple markets, and preferably have online travel experience. 


Deliver international marketing campaign calendar (360 Digital marketing mix) and manage the International marketing matrix to ensure online travel campaigns drive increased online sales & revenue growth for ATO across International markets.
Act as AMEX Travel Online (ATO) Brand Guardian for all marketing activity, and support delivery of Global Brand Strategy on ATO, across International markets.
Deliver against the Global Hotel Offer Strategy, by ensuring that all offers are accurately and appropriately merchandised on our key home and landing pages and throughout the customer booking path.
Support delivery of ATO Offer Strategy (DoE, Registered Card, MR, Global Hotel Sales) and Partner management (Key Hotel / Car Hire Vendors) to deliver 2018 ATO marketing campaign calendar in International markets.
Support delivery of new market launches in International.
Increase the site look to book (LTB) ratio by ensuring on-site messaging up-to-date, accurate and aligns to the Cardmember promise.
Work to drive a seamless customer journey with robust, clear, accurate and relevant content to engage and convert.
Ensuring all activity, including digital marketing (Owned, Paid & Earned Media), merchandised offers and content meets all local market regulatory & legal compliance.
Work with the greater ATO marketing and product management-capabilities team, local markets and the vendor to ensure that onsite updates are managed smoothly and in a timely fashion.
Ensure that the onsite calendar of activity aligns all ATO central and local marketing plans for each site and each market.
Utilise onsite analytics to make informed recommendations for proposed site changes and optimisation Develop and maintain strong operational relationships with internal and external teams.

 
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
Qualifications

Required skills:


Ability to advise and influence stakeholders and teams not under direct control
Strong communication skills and the ability to communicate credibly with internal & external partners and colleagues
Ability to work on own initiative and in uncertain conditions – must be a ‘self-starter’
Be analytically minded with an excellent attention to detail
Demonstrated experience of working with agencies
Highly organized with effective time management skills
Have experience in devising and running merchandising campaigns
Experience of working with geographically/culturally diverse teams
Have knowledge of content management systems
Experience in online marketing mix

American Express invites you to share your resume so you can be considered for future Manager/Senior Manager-level opportunities in the New York, Phoenix, and Fort Lauderdale areas in Enterprise Digital & Analytics (EDA).

EDA partners closely with colleagues in issuing businesses, and across the Blue-Box to drive growth and market place differentiation with new card member acquisition.
 

 
Job Responsibilities:
 

As Product Owner, Manager/Senior Manager, you will have direct input into the strategies and product roadmap for customer journey to drive new card member growth. This role includes interaction with several business partners from diverse cultures, and in varying time zones and may include light travel (5%-10%).
 


Translate product roadmap into well-defined product requirements, user stories and acceptance test criteria
Partner closely with in-house, agile scrum team as well as across other product/tech teams to test and deliver features in the product backlog with core focus on driving billed business
Develop and maintain strong operational relationships with key stakeholders across market and central teams in various roles such as Marketing, Technology, New Accounts, Risk, Fraud, Legal, Compliance and , Sales/Business Development and Operations
Monitor the competitive landscape and industry trends to inform the product development strategy
Qualifications

Experience driving medium and large scale capability initiatives (experience rolling out capabilities for customer facing professionals or external third party partners is highly desired)
Experience as a Product Owner, developing and enhancing features through continuous optimization
Willingness and ability to work proactively and independently
Ability to juggle multiple priorities, operate effectively in dynamic environment and rigorously prioritize initiatives based on business objectives
Excellent oral and written communication skills, ability to interact effectively to all levels, and influence and drive results without direct authority
Demonstrated problem solving and decision-making skills
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Strong track record of driving results, innovation and change in a fast paced environment (global or international specific initiatives is highly desired)
Willingness and flexibility to manage partner relationships across time zones and geographies
Experience with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint to summarize complex analyses for varied audiences
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, Industrial Engineering, Economics, Computer Science, or job experience in related fields  
Preferred Additional/Desired Skills: 


Digital marketing experience, mobile or web applications, or experience building digital experiences and customer journeys with creative or third party agencies is highly desired (familiarity with UX/UI principles, Usability testing, Responsive Web Design etc)
Experience working in agile product ownership role and familiarity with agile methodology is highly desired
Knowledge of digital conversion optimization, acquisition process in payment/credit card business, networks, platforms, and procedures preferred

Description:
American Express invites you to share your resume so you can be considered for future Manager/Senior Manager-level opportunities in the New York and Phoenix areas in Enterprise Digital & Analytics (EDA).

EDA partners closely with colleagues in issuing businesses, and across the Blue-Box to drive growth and market place differentiation with new card member acquisition.
 
Prospect Acquisition is one of the largest investments in Global Consumer Services Group (GCSG) and Enterprise Digital Analytics (EDA) team creates central, scalable marketing solutions and analytics capabilities to accelerate growth in many core business areas including Digital Acquisitions. 
 
This role in EDA would be responsible for analytics and digital targeting to support GCSG in meeting the prospect acquisition goals. Working in close partnership with Global Channel Marketing, Product and Lending teams, the incumbent is expected to design and implement effective acquisition strategies across our global Affiliate and Cobrand partnerships. The incumbent is expected to advance data driven precision marketing techniques using world class analytics and data science, in collaborating across a variety of teams including Marketing, Capabilities, Technologies and vendors to drive results and help American Express achieve its acquisition goals with improved efficiency and quality.
 
Job Responsibilities: 

Designing targeting, segmentation logic, test and learn design, campaign execution & analytics for digital acquisition channels
Leveraging digital data to expand precision marketing to ensure best in class customer experience and maximum value from acquisitions
Analyzing performance of current initiatives and present findings and solutions to senior leadership. Publish monthly MIS and deep dive into changes in trends 
Working in close collaboration with capability teams to identify and evaluate new data sources and develop new channel integrations
Create convincing business cases highlighting opportunities to implement innovative targeting solutions across partners and channels; infuse marketing strategy with data driven approach 
 Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree is highly preferred
2+ years professional experience is highly preferred
Strong ability to drive results; self-starter
Expertise in application of analytics (applied statistics/quantitative methods) for solving business problems. Exposure to digital data and web analytics is a plus
Prior programming experience in SAS, SQL and/or Hive. Understanding of web tracking data and related technologies (Java, HTML) is a plus
Proven ability to analyze large and unstructured data sets
Ability to multi-task, operate effectively under changing conditions and rigorously prioritize initiatives based on business objectives

Description:
Org details
The American Express Global Remittance platform powers the movement of over one trillion dollars around the world every year. We are looking for a passionate and experienced product leader for a Director Product Owner to join the Global Remittance Platform team. In this role you will drive the vision, strategy and innovation of product capabilities ensuring that it meets the evolving needs of the enterprise, problem solving in a fast moving environment and helping revolutionize the software delivery model for American Express.
The Global Remittance team is part of American Express’ Enterprise Platforms organization.  Enterprise Platforms is a newly formed organization whose core purpose is to transform, the platform solution-delivery model for American Express, dramatically improving our strategic agility, speed to market, effectiveness of delivery and transparency while simultaneously delivering world class software products to our customers. 
The Enterprise Platforms team has three core charters of responsibility:

Platforms: This team is the proving ground for transforming our software delivery model so that a single unified team is responsible for the product development, engineering, architecture and service management of enterprise platforms. Today, there are four large scale platforms within Enterprise Platforms: Global Remittance, Global Loyalty & Benefits, Global Salesforce, and Global Accounts Receivable.
Platform Strategy: This team will ensure cohesive oversight of platforms across the Enterprise, including infrastructure uplift and the resolution of overlapping priorities as well as how AXP’s platforms adapt to emerging trends and customer demands.
Product Management: This team will serve as a product talent management hub, help drive consistency of product management practices and build a talent pipeline, as well as foster a collaborative culture across the Enterprise.
Global Remittance is a crucial component of our macro-level business processes; Authorization, Merchants Payables, Billing and Payments. The Payments landscape across American Express is undergoing unprecedented change that includes rapid development of new product innovations, evolving technology standards and an ever changing money movement landscape. The Director of Product Management for Global Remittance will focus on driving capability of strategic priorities whilst preparing for future trends, enhancing our customer experience and addressing internal gaps.
 
Job Description 




 Focus 

Accountable for the creation and delivery of a product or suite of products within American Express. Responsible for leading and evangelizing a full feature and capability roadmap for a specific product, facilitating go-to-market and/or upgrade strategies, driving innovation and quality with internal and external teams, and ensuring that our organization builds and protects the American Express brand. 


Organizational Context 

Reports to a VP in a Product Management organization within a Business, AXP Staff Group or Technology Shared Services team and may have people leadership responsibilities for Group Product Managers, Senior Product Managers, Product Managers and Associate Product Managers. 


Key Responsibilities 

 

Defines a product portfolio vision and strategy aligned with high-level vision and strategy 
Defines product outcomes for the product segment, in line with the high-level product portfolio and company, organizational outcomes 
Understands and applies new trends and market standard methodologies into product roadmap and requirements 
Communicates and build consensus across multiple departments in crafting the product roadmap 
Responsible for the full-cycle management of a single product which includes: Assess Market, Craft Product Strategy, Create Product Vision, Build Product Roadmap, Plan Product Release, Design and Development, and Execution/Launch of a product 
Understand the market and customers’ needs, and translate into a value 
Defines and articulates a long-term product strategy and roadmap with clearly defined business metrics and targets 
Develops appropriate tracking and reporting to track product performance post launch in order to evaluate future investment 
Produces return on investment analyses and optimization recommendations 
Identifies risks, challenges, opportunities and business integration needs 
Make rapid feature, schedule and cost tradeoff decisions and communicate in real time to key partners 
Leads product managers and associate product managers to translate product roadmap into a product backlog of well-defined epics and features with appropriate acceptance criteria 
Ensures the sprint backlog is consistent with the Product Roadmap and performs story elaboration with the implementation team as necessary 
Works closely with the technology team to develop, test and deliver the defined capabilities and rapidly iterate new solutions as needed 
Reviews and accepts completed user stories as needed 
Define and communicates metrics for a product to all critical partners involved in the product management life cycle 
Coordinates communications, advances and facilitates resolution of risks, issues, and changes tied to the product development 
Align with partners during planning, launch, and iterative states 
Facilitate teamwork and alignment between cross-functional teams including engagement, design, analytics, engineering, and experimentation 
Work with key partners across the Organization, as necessary, in support of product(s) 
Work within and across business units to prioritize, plan, and execute the development schedule for major product releases 
Work with system/platform architects to understand and prioritize architectural features across platforms/products 
Confirm available product resourcing and funding from responsible parties 
 


Scope of Impact/Influence 

 

Work closely with customers and partners to define, develop, and implement development efforts to drive the greatest value for our customers. 
Define product outcomes for their product segment, in line with the high-level product portfolio, and will be accountable for meeting those outcomes 
 
 
 
Qualifications




Education & Experience 

 

8+ years of experience in Product Management with proven track record in defining winning product constructs and delivering a product roadmap 
Experience with rapid and iterative software development methodologies 
Proven track record managing large, complex products with multiple partners 
 


Knowledge/Skills 

 

Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, engineering or a related technical discipline required; MS preferred 
 


Technology Core Competencies 

 

Adaptive Communication 
Agile Practices 
Industry and Company Knowledge 
Organizational Change Management 
Technical Acumen 
Technology Industry Trends 
 


Game Changers 

 

Adaptability 
Collaboration & Teamwork 
Continuous Improvement 
Courage 
Curiosity 
Ingenuity 
Servant Leadership 
Tenacity 
 


Role Core Competencies 

Technical 

System/Platform Domain Knowledge 
 
Functional 

Business Analysis 
Financial Management 
User Experience Evaluation and Analysis 
 
Leadership 

Analytical Thinking 
Builds High Performing Teams 
Consultancy 
Decision-Making 
Executive Presence 
Influence and Negotiation 
 
Business 

Business Case Development 
Business Product Knowledge 
Problem Solving

You won’t just shape the world of software.
You’ll shape the world of life, work and play.
 
Our Software Engineers not only understand how technology works, but how that technology intersects with the people who count on it every day. Today, innovative ideas, insight and new perspectives are at the core of how we create a more powerful, personal and fulfilling experience for all our customers. So if you’re interested in a career creating breakthrough software and making an impact on an audience of millions, look no further.
 
You won’t just keep up, you’ll break new ground.  
 
If you are itching for a new challenge this job is for you. We work on new products that are going to power American Express in to the future. Bring your creative ideas and sky is limit for what we can achieve as a team.
 
You won’t just keep up, you’ll break new ground. 
 
There are hundreds of opportunities to make your mark on technology and life at American Express. Here’s just some of what you’ll be doing:
 

Taking your place as a core member of an agile team driving the latest development practices
Writing code and unit tests, working with API specs and automation
Identifying opportunities for adopting new technologies
Developing microservices using Java and deploying them on enterprise cloud
Troubleshooting issues and working with product support teams to resolve problems and perform root cause analysis
Mentoring junior engineering staff
Working closely with Product Owners in researching and prototyping new capabilities that improve the overall user experience
  
 QualificationsAre you up for the challenge?
 

Preferably a BS or MS degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other technical discipline
12+ years of software development experience
Ability to effectively interpret technical and business objectives and challenges and articulate solutions
Willingness to learn new technologies and exploit them to their optimal potential
At the core of Software Engineering
 
The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of and proven background in backend development using technologies such as: Java, SQL & NOSQL databases, Messaging infrastructure(kafka etc). Basic understanding of UI development is preferred.
 

Agile Practices
Porting/Software Configuration
Programming Languages and Frameworks
Business Analysis
Analytical Thinking
Highly focused, organized, and detail-oriented
Strong technical aptitude with an intense desire to learn new skills and industry trends
Strong leadership skills & ability to collaborate across development portfolios to drive results
Demonstrated experience using CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, XLR, Sonar, Selenium, Chef etc
Business Product Knowledge
Basic of understanding of UI development with HTML and other front end technologies preferred
Demonstrated experience in leveraging open source tools and adapting to common frameworks

Description:
You’ll do more than the expected. You’ll do the unexpected. 
Who are we?
Accertify Inc & InAuth are 100% owned subsidiaries of American Express. We employ over 500 employees globally and provide industry leading Fraud Risk Management solutions. Our UK team are based in our London office which is conveniently located next to Victoria station. We pride ourselves on our agile, creative approach to solving problems and helping our customers succeed. 
Our teams
Our Technical Support Analysts are part of a global team who work directly with our customers and partner closely with our Technical Engineers to provide technical solutions. Our Technical Support Analysts are primarily office based and work on-call schedules however, we do encourage flexible working that allows employees to balance time in the office with working from home and some business travel.  
The challenge
We believe in our people and we are committed to developing their careers. Our objective is to build a talented Technical Support team who will deliver a 1st class service to our customers. Successful individuals will have plenty of opportunity to further their careers and are well suited to future roles such as a Senior Technical Engineer or a Technical Support people leader.
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.Qualifications
The ideal candidate
Whilst we would like experienced candidates we also welcome recent graduates who have a relevant degree and can demonstrate an interest and passion in what we do.
Required skills:


Prior experience working in customer service
Excellent written & verbal communication skills  
Fluent English essential, 1 other European language advantageous though not essential
University  degree in a technical subject such as Computer Science or proven experience in application support, preferably supporting software as a service (SaaS)
Experience with technical troubleshooting
Prior fraud or payments industry experience

Description:
American Expressin Suomen markkina-alueen jatkaessa kasvuaan tarvitsee myös asiakaspalvelumme lisää työntekijöitä. Etsimmekin suomenkielisiä ja tiimihenkisiä asiakaspalvelijoita Customer Care Professional –rooliin.
Työskennellessäsi Customer Care Professional –roolissa vastaat asiakkaidemme kysymyksiin puhelimitse. Asiakkaidemme kysymykset vaihtelevat yleisistä kysymyksistä aina monimutkaisempiin laskutusta, vakuutuksia ja korttietuja koskeviin kysymyksiin. Sen lisäksi, että vastaat asiakkaiden kysymyksiin ja autat heidän ongelmiensa ratkaisemisessa, pyrit myös itse aktiivisesti tekemään asiakkaillemme suosituksia, joiden avulla he saavat kortistaan entistäkin enemmän irti. Työtehtäviin kuuluu myös muita toimistotehtäviä.
Rooliin etsimme henkilöä, jolla on aiempaa kokemusta asiakaspalvelutyöstä ja innokas ote asiakaspalveluun sekä hyvät vuorovaikutustaidot. Asetamme tavoitteemme korkealle American Expressillä ja etsimmekin henkilöä, joka on määrätietoinen ja valmis tekemään töitä näiden tavoitteiden saavuttamiseksi.  Aloitteellisuus ja kyky toimia nopeatempoisessa ympäristössä ovat myös tärkeitä ominaisuuksia tässä roolissa. 
Työsuhde alkaa maaliskuussa 2019 kahdeksan viikon koulutuksella, joka sisältää sekä teoreettisen että käytännöllisen osuuden. Ajan myötä tulet kehittymään ja kasvamaan tähän rooliin, ja tarjoammekin hyvät edellytykset ja mahdollisuudet siihen, että pääset tarjoamaan asiakkaillemme erinomaista palvelua ja tämän myötä ansaitsemaan bonuksia bonusohjelmassamme. Tuemme sinua myös jatkuvasti, jotta pääset edelleen kehittymään roolissasi. Tarjoammekin sinulle mahdollisuuden kehittää itseäsi ja taitojasi, ja olla osana globaalissa ja jännittävässä yhtiössä. 

Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
Qualifications 

 

Etsimmekö kenties juuri sinua?

Sinulla on aiempaa kokemusta asiakaspalvelutyöstä ja nautit siitä.
Työskentely nopeatempoisessa ympäristössä ei ole sinulle ongelma.
Puhut sujuvaa suomea ja myös englanti luonnistuu. Ruotsin kielitaito on iso plussa.
Hallitset tietokoneella työskentelyn.
Olet määrätietoinen ja tuloshakuinen.
Sinulla on toisen asteen koulutus.
Olet valmis aloittamaan roolissa maaliskuussa 2019.ReqID: 18020043Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Jan 18, 2019, 5:41:35 AM
Job Title: Asiakaspalvelija / Finnish Speaking Customer Care Professional

Description:
Job Description (External)

El Ejecutivo de Ventas en American Express tendrá como responsabilidad principal la venta de tarjetas de Crédito y Servicio a nuevos clientes, de manera presencial (modulo y citas), mediante una efectiva perfilación de clientes con alto poder adquisitivo, y construyendo con ellos relaciones a largo plazo a través de un seguimiento postventa.
Realizar la venta directa de tarjetas de crédito y servicio existentes en nuestro portafolio de manera mensual, lograr la activación de dichas tarjetas en un periodo máximo de 3 meses a la fecha de venta, y lograr una facturación por tarjeta de acuerdo a lo establecido por el canal, dando seguimiento post-venta.
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.Qualifications


Experiencia actual mínima de 1 año como Asesor de Ventas presencial en productos o servicios (venta en módulos y venta en citas).
Preferentemente con experiencia en el sector financiero (Tarjetas de Crédito, Inversiones, Seguros), sector telecomunicaciones, automotriz o de marcas Premium.
Disponibilidad de horario.
Deseable tener cartera de clientes.
Excelente presentación.
Ambicioso y perseverante. 
Deseable tener automóvil.
Estudios mínimos de preparatoria.
Manejo básico de Microsoft Office (Word, Excel).
Manejo de Microsoft Outlook.
Entendimiento básico del idioma inglés.
“Day and night we make things happen for our Cardmembers, 24/7 all over the world. Our dedicated team ensure anniversaries are not forgotten, they track down lost wedding dresses, personally deliver replacement cards, and find doctors who speak the local language. It’s everyday heroics that define our world-class approach to customer service. And at American Express, we call it something different- Relationship Care®. Because we view every customer interaction as an opportunity to grow, advance and deepen those relationships.”

 ReqID: 18019394Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Jan 17, 2019, 12:22:29 PM

American Express in the Nordic region is one of the fastest growing international businesses of American Express world-wide. The Nordic Consumer Card team is focused on continuing to grow and develop American Express´ presence and footprint in the Nordic region. Through strategic thought leadership rapidly translated in to tactical implementation activities, the team is working hard to transform American Express´ presence in the region in to a fast growing, highly efficient and customer-centric operation. This involves the restructuring and transformation of existing activities and operations as well as the implementation of new strategies and partnerships that will be instrumental to drive growth in turnover, profitability and customer satisfaction.
 
We are looking for a strategic and analytical conversionista to strengthen our newly built acquisition capabilities team. Responsibilities will have a broad range from tactical product set ups to leading more strategic projects with conversion optimization in focus! You would for example be responsible to continuously optimize our online sales channels/homepage with increased acquisition results in mind. We work closely with internal teams and external partners and you will responsible to develop these relationships, bring these parties together in order to deliver best in class results. You should be familiar with A/B testing, conversion optimization tools and web analytics.
 
We work in fast changing and agile environment so you´ll need to be proactive, keen to learn new things and prepared to work hard to get things done in an efficient and impactful manner, always with a friendly and positive attitude. Reporting into the Acquisition Marketing Manager in Stockholm, this role will be tasked with driving key initiatives that will deliver transformational growth for the Nordic region. S/he will work closely with colleagues in the region and across the high performing central teams. A successful candidate will possess very good organizational and communication skills and an eye for detail. 
 
What you’ll do:


Responsible for Nordic CRO strategy and implementation
Analyze and optimize acquisition channels and drive more acquisition efficiency
Own MGM (member get member) channel and develop it to reach full potential in all  Nordic markets
Maintain and develop the relationship with internal teams and  external agencies
Competitive analysis and market research 
Work closely with central teams on strategic projects, bringing local market knowledge and language expertise

Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.Qualifications
Required skills:


B.Sc. or M.Sc. degree in the field of e.g. Marketing, Business Administration or Economics  
1-3 years relevant working experience within marketing, e-commerce, conversion optimization, or finance industry experience
Well-developed analytical skills 
Advanced level in Microsoft Office e.g. Excel, Power Point
Fluent in English and Swedish (Finnish and/or Norwegian is seen as a plus but not required) 1-3 years relevant working experience from payment industry or similar
Ability to run multiple initiatives in parallel with a strong sense of planning and prioritizing work
A self-starter with proactive attitude
Natural collaborator who enjoys working with and others, to support the success of the team
Advanced level in Microsoft Office e.g. Excel, Power Point
Curios and innovative mindset
Passion in consumer digital behaviour and/or conversion optimization is a must

What we offer:


Great opportunity to build a foundational understanding of the Nordic consumer Card business to enable further growth within the American Express business locally or abroad
Play a vital role of driving the growth in the Nordics s
Work for a Fortune500 company

Our Blue Box Values:


Quality - We provide outstanding products and unsurpassed service that, together, deliver premium value to our customers.
Integrity - We uphold the highest standards of integrity in all of our actions.
Teamwork - We work together, across boundaries, to meet the needs of our customers and to help the company win.
Personal Accountability - We are personally accountable for delivering on our commitments

ReqID: 19000486Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Jan 17, 2019, 5:36:24 AM

The Team:  The selected candidate will be joining the consumer sales team of American Express Spain.  The team is responsible for two very important pillars: Prospect Card acquisition and Cardmember cross sell. The Prospect Card acquisition pillar is two-fold as it includes launching performance driven campaigns for 1) new prospects across offline and online channels and 2) the Cardmember referral program. And, the Cardmember cross sell pillar includes multiple initiatives to deepen the existing Cardmember relationship.  The team strives to collectively help each other reach the mutual goals and test and learn via innovating with creative, marketing campaigns and capabilities.
 
Responsibilities:  This online paid media specialist is a sales role and is responsible for the end-to-end execution of online campaigns aimed at increasing the demand of American Express consumer Cards in Spain, and most importantly meeting monthly paid media Card acquisition targets.
 
You will be responsible for deliver cutting edge measurement, reporting and analysis of paid media (search, display, programmatic, etc.) performance to drive customer acquisition across all digital channels; maximize the efficiency of paid performance and to maximize revenue generation and business growth.  We are looking for a proven leader in the digital space that has extensive knowledge and experience in Paid Search, Display Media, Affiliates, Search Engine Optimization, User Experience, Content Marketing and Conversion Optimization.  
 
The right candidate will let their passion for all things digital heavily influence the American Express digital sales strategy, and the following processes:  briefing creative agencies, setting up campaigns, tracking, testing and launching the campaigns.  Post launch, it is critical to analyze results and have sound arguments for optimal attribution of sales leads.  Attention to detail/quality as well as being accountable for all aspects of the end-to-end campaigns is expected.  Success will be measured by driving incremental Card acquisitions, and exceeding the yearly sales goal.
 
Vision:  This role is key to the future of the Spanish market as we transition into a more digital market.  The selected candidate should be a hard worker and be prepared to grow at American Express as digital marketing becomes increasingly more prominent with consumers.  The candidate must have a passion for all things digital and strong knowledge of marketing, selling and branding.

Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.Qualifications
Required skills:


Be able to articulate a digital performance sales methodology based on experience
Passion for online sales and marketing
At least five years of experience in B2C online paid media and digital attribution
Expert in digital selling and driving to web campaigns; experience with online to offline geomarketing campaigns is a plus
Impeccable command of Spanish grammar and excellent written communication skills
High level of English both written and verbal
Experience creating briefs and clearly articulating creative requirements internally and to agencies
University degree in Communications, Marketing or Journalism preferred
Master's degree is a plus

If you are passionate about serving customers, results driven and interested in working for a world-class global brand, then the American Express Platinum Customer Care Professional position may be an ideal fit for you. As a Platinum Customer Care Professional, you serve as the face and voice of the American Express brand. You have the opportunity to make a meaningful difference in the lives of customers. Our unique servicing philosophy, Relationship Care® puts your passion to serve – and your personality – at the center of every customer interaction, creating an opportunity to deliver value to our customers while deepening relationships with our company.

American Express Platinum Customer Care Professionals deliver extraordinary care by promptly and accurately responding to customer inquiries. Customer Care Professionals strive to make it easy to do business with us, solving customer issues, while celebrating their value to us.

As a Platinum Customer Care Professional, you will be responsible for evaluating and analyzing account information and recommending tailored solutions to our customers, reinforcing the benefits of membership by providing relevant offers that deepen customer engagement with our products and services.

What would you do every day as a Platinum Customer Care Professional?  


Deliver extraordinary customer care by responding to questions concerning customer accounts in a fast paced, structured customer care environment
Grow and nurture customer relationships on every interaction that results in measurable customer value
Document necessary account information and offer custom solutions that benefit the customer
Deliver extraordinary results measured by customer satisfaction, effectiveness, efficiency and quality Qualifications
We are looking for the following:


Minimum of 3-5 years of customer service experience with a passion for building customer loyalty through exceptional listening, relationship building, and strong written and verbal communication
Ability to work in a fast paced metric driven environment with proficient multitasking and navigation in a windows environment
Demonstrated consultative experience, ability to influence, resourcefulness
Experience owning or working in a small business a plus
Bachelor’s degree preferred
This position operates in a 24/7 environment.

Description:
American Express is embarking on an exciting Cloud and Mobile transformation driven by an energetic team of high performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. You will lead Cloud Security Architecture working with cross-functional and cross-enterprise teams that define requirements (business and technical), develop architecture specifications, assess and select vendors/products, pilot new technology elements and process, develop enterprise-scale deployment plans and lead initial implementations. The role will work closely with other Information Security departments, architecture and development teams, and external cloud providers on requirements, design, integration and delivery of these solutions.
 
Responsibilities

Provide senior security architectural leadership to all phases of the Cloud Program, including the Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Cloud Application Architecture subprograms.
Work closely with subject matter experts to develop and deliver a complete security architecture solution
Lead technical analysis and recommendations (e.g. evaluate and select vendor security products based on functional, security and operational requirements; review and comment on security architecture)
Lead technical design and first instance deployment of global projects including security solutions for internal and external IaaS and PaaS clouds (e.g. collaborate with risk analysts, project managers and technical subject matter experts to design, plan and implement enterprise security solutions spanning the endpoint, network and application space)
Produce (contribute to and oversee others) high quality documentation (e.g. Architecture Specifications, System Requirements, Roadmaps, White Papers) to accurately capture and communicate business drivers, technical requirements, system design, and future plans and provide thought leadership at the enterprise level).
Present cloud security architectural design concepts and solutions to all levels in the organization
Build cloud optimized architecture patterns and contribute to Enterprise Architecture governance.
Compare and evaluate various private, public cloud technologies and tools from technical, functional and financial feasibility.
Drive proof of concepts that assess the feasibility of solutions and demonstrate to our product partners how technology can be leveraged.
Gather requirements; build functional specifications, timelines, adoption plans and other artifacts to support security implementation.
Work with stakeholders within and across Business Unit teams to collaborate, enable, and drive decision making.
Work with various businesses to evaluate various technologies including setting up POC, evaluation criteria, managing professional services resources for design, architecture and implementation.
Partner with and support the Engineering team to drive and execute results in a timely mannerQualifications

Must possess deep industry solution expertise and drive high priority customer initiatives. This is a solution and technical role that is accountable for the end-to-end cloud deployment experience. This Senior Security Architecture role will own Security engagement including: business architecture, solution architecture, facilitate architectural design sessions, manage specific implementation programs with corresponding Proofs of Concept plans.

Demonstrated experience in Agile environments, application design, software development, and testing
Expertise in cloud architecture and security fundamentals including containers, software-defined networks, high availability design, multicloud, and serverless compute
Application experience migrating to or building natively in a cloud environment including monolithic applications, microservices, and functions as a service
Experience with Windows and Linux operating systems
Experience with network architecture, network security, and TCP/IP
Experience with secure Java application design and development using J2EE, Spring, and SQL
Experience with secure JavaScript and Single Page App design and development using node.js, React, and NoSQL
Hands on with Docker and Kubernetes preferred
Experience with a broad range of application architectures, languages, and payments technologies a plus
3+ years of experience in cloud security environment
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, computer engineering, or related field; advanced degree preferred
Information Security Certification preferred, CISSP or similar 
 

 
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

Fondé en 1850, American Express Company est un acteur majeur du voyage d'affaires et premier émetteur de cartes non bancaires. American Express est un groupe international présent dans le voyage et les services financiers au travers de 5 grandes activités : Cartes pour particuliers et petites entreprises, Cartes et solutions pour grandes entreprises, Réseau de commerçants, Change et Voyages d'Affaires (sous forme de JV). Classée 23ème marque internationale (et 1ère marque financière) reconnue pour sa valeur et sa notoriété au classement Interbrand, American Express compte 53 500 collaborateurs à travers le monde dont 700 à la carte en France. 
 
Avec plus de 20 langues parlées et une dizaine de nationalités différentes dans ses effectifs, la marque est dotée d’une véritable culture de la Diversité avec une direction dédiée. La mission Diversité d’American Express a entre autres pour vocation de faciliter l’intégration professionnelle de personnes en situation de handicap et se tient à la disposition des candidats pour évoquer avec eux leurs éventuels besoins d’accompagnement. 
 
American Express Global Commercial Services is the leading provider of Corporate Card Programs, Supplier Payments Solutions and other expense management tools that help mid-size companies and large corporations around the world manage almost all the facets of their business spending.
 
Within Global Marketing, The Global Field Enablement (FE) team leads all field go to market communication strategies for our 4,000 global field Sales and Account Development (Account Sales) organization, training, and programs to drive field tool adoption. This includes innovative learning and delivery programs to enable our field to provide a best in class prospect and customer experience as well as creative and engaging communications of critical business content such a new products, services, and tools.  As experts in large field team needs and go to market strategies, we partner across the business on internal go to market strategies.  
 
The Analyst of Field Enablement, FRANCE will join a very exciting, collaborative and high visibility team and will be providing critical support to the Manager, Field Enablement France, and be focused on driving Sales and Account Sales productivity and success by:

Partnering with field teams to understand most critical needs, and be a credible voice for the field
Supporting the end to end strategy and project management of innovative and experiential/digital field training programs, with a primary focus on building a best in class training path (new hire and tenured training)
Delivering and facilitating select training programs, in strong partnership with the field as well as external vendors to ensure a best in class, modern and engaging training experience across all parameters of training
Collaborating very closely with key partners from Marketing, Product, Risk, DS&I and others
Supporting digital tool/Salesforce adoption initiatives within the segment, in partnership with the Global Salesforce Adoption and Global Learning COE teams, with a focus on training
Helping to define and drive key performance indicators to inform and drive success
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
 Qualifications 
Required skills: 

Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in sales enablement, training, marketing, general management, or B2B consulting field sales/account development/support roles
Outstanding project management skills a must
Experience collaborating across many functional areas (such as field, marketing, product, risk, operations) to lead the design and delivery of relevant, timely, and engaging large scale digital/virtual/and experiential training programs
Proven passion for working with a customer orientation and global mindset.
Strong problem solving skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment and prioritization 
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Ambitious self-starter, with a strong work ethic, intense will-to-win, and demonstrated personal excellence
Enthusiastic, fun, flexible and demonstrates a willingness to learn

American Express Netherlands has the following job opportunity: 
 
Product Marketing Director – Consumer Netherlands
Since our earliest days, we’ve strived to find new ways to enrich our customers’ lives, have their backs and provide our special brand of service, in ways both big and small. As our business transformed – from freight forwarding to travel to cards to innovative digital products and services – one thing has remained constant: our unwavering commitment to earn our customers’ loyalty for the long haul. Our vision is to provide the world’s best customer experience every day and become essential to our customers by providing differentiated products and services to help them achieve their aspirations.
 
Reporting to the Country Manager in the Netherlands, you will lead a team of marketing professionals, responsible for defining and delivering the product and marketing strategy for our Consumer Card portfolio (B2C), as well as the management and execution of marketing campaigns, events and projects with the objective to drive business growth, increase share of wallet as well as Card member engagement. You will be responsible for the relationship with our co-brand partner Air France - KLM (Flying Blue) and will work closely with local and international teams. 
 
Key Responsibilities:

Maintain, develop and implement a strong consumer product and marketing strategy to drive billings & revenue growth, increased share of wallet, reduced attrition and improve the NPS 
Delivering a seamless end-to-end customer experience 
Lead the development of card member marketing communications calendar including product refreshes, events, newsletters, (online) spend stimulation and cross-sell initiatives
Lead, build and leverage a strong partnership with KLM and Flying Blue to deliver continuous growth in the cobrand portfolio and meet contractual commitments
Build strong partnerships with key internal stakeholders (eg. Central and Regional Marketing, Operational Excellence, Analytical and Product teams) to ensure card member marketing initiatives, supporting capabilities and infrastructure are prioritized to deliver great customer and commercial outcomes while ensuring being compliant with local regulations
Provide strong thought leadership on new and emerging card member value propositions, products and engagement capabilities in the market place
Build, lead and develop a high performing, highly engaged marketing team of marketers with skills and expertise across engagement, customer experience, digital, and premium marketing 







 
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
Qualifications

Required skills:


Excellent verbal and written presentation skills in Dutch and English
A Bachelor degree qualification in relation to the role
Proven customer-driven strategic approach and getting things done mentality
Excellent analytical skills and strategic thinking abilities
Growth mindset
Proven people leadership experience and ability to lead, motivate, engage and develop a high performing team
Outstanding interpersonal and relationship management skills (collaboration and influencing), allowing for the management of strong relationships in a complex matrix organisation with senior stakeholders, multiple objectives across internal teams and external partners
Strong knowledge of consumer business and (premium) marketing
Experience and knowledge of offer governance principles and close collaboration with Legal, Compliance and Risk
Demonstrate agile decision making that balances speed and quality
Creative thinking that can combine best practices with new ideas to create compelling experiences for customers that will grow their engagement with our brand

You’ll do more than the expected. You’ll do the unexpected. 

We are looking for high performing and enthusiastic Software Engineers to join our Global Commercial Services technology team in American Express, Burgess Hill.
 
These roles will partner closely with our product owners within collaborative scrum teams, in an environment that values interesting technical challenges, using best practice design approaches and prioritises your professional development.
 
Your primary proven software development experience will be using Java Technologies; for example some of JPA and CDI, Spring MVC, Spring Data and Spring Boot and RESTful microservices.
 
Job responsibilities:


Writes clean, tested and monitored scalable code
Works with Product Owners to prioritise features for ongoing sprints
Works with Quality Engineers to ensure automated test scripts are incorporated for new features
Performs all technical aspects of software development for assigned applications, including developing prototypes, writing new code and creating API's
Designs and builds integration components and interfaces in collaboration with Architects and Infrastructure Engineers as necessary
Salary: CompetitiveOpening date for applications: 15/01/2019Closing date for applications: 12/02/2019


Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
Qualifications


Required skills:


Relevant software development experience (minimum Java 7, Java 8 preferable) in a professional environment and/or comparable experience such as:
Demonstrated experience working in a team of Engineers
Hands-on expertise with application design, software development and automated testing
University Degree in computer science, computer science engineering, or related field or equivalent experience
Experience in Agile techniques, preferably some experience with BDD and TDD
Understands the complete vertical platform environment (technical stack)
Exposure to distributed (multi-tiered) systems and relational databases
Good collaboration and communication skills across all cultures and band levels, and enthusiastic about keeping up to date with new technologies

Some of the following experience would also be desirable:


Knowledge of Spring including MVC, AOP, Spring Boot, REST, XML, Microservice architecture, Cucumber, JPA, JUnit, Mocking, JSP, Oracle DB SQL
Experience with Functional Programming practices
Front end web development skills such as HTML5, Javascript, AJAX, JQuery, CSS
Cloud experience, for example Docker, OpenShift, Unix and service discovery tools
Experience with performance and monitoring tools e.g. Splunk and App Dynamics
Experience developing RESTful API’s and micro services
Knowledge of automated build / continuous delivery, experience of Maven, Jenkins, Groovy and other JVM languages a plus
Current knowledge of payments industry, financial services or FinTech

Purpose
 
American Express’s mission is to be world’s most respected service brand. Global Servicing Network protects American Express' assets by minimizing credit and fraud losses at best-in-class levels. We utilize outstanding techniques, ensuring compliance with all regulatory requirements, and provide superior service to improve customer and shareholder value. We will accomplish this by having the most talented teams who are supported by best-in-class capabilities and processes.
Position Summary
As a Collections Associate you will be responsible for building relationships with our customers, whose account payments are overdue, assisting them with their situation and solving their problems to reach a positive conclusion for both American Express and our valued clients. This role will involve making outbound or inbound calls to our valued customers. The objective of the call is to gain the customers commitment to making payments on their overdue account and enabling them to spend on the card.
Key Deliverables


Handling inbound and outbound calls from our consumer and small business card members whose accounts are flagged as overdue or delinquent using written and verbal communication.

Risk analysis and review of customer accounts, recommending process improvements where relevant.

Review the risk of accounts to assess whether to permit or stop further spend, compliance with privacy and consumer credit legislation.

Building rapport with the card members and actively listening to the issues that may have arisen.

Negotiation with card members to determine the best course of action and gaining agreement for both short and long term solutions.

Respond to card members enquiries in an appropriate manner, offering personalized service with a ‘can do’ attitude

Ensures maximum recovery on accounts through inbound/ outbound telephone contact in a timely and comprehensive manner to ensure customer satisfaction with Inbound and Outbound calling.
 
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
 
PHGCA
 Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree, associate’s degree and college undergrads may apply

At least 2 years of experience in credit card collections is required.

Ability to work in a fast paced metric driven environment with proficient multitasking and navigation in a windows environment.

Strong interpersonal, communication and listening skills

Excellent negotiation skills

American Express Recruitment Center28/F Bonifacio One Technology Tower3030 Rizal Drive corner 31st StreetBonifacio Global City, TaguigPhilippines

               Realizar la venta directa de tarjetas de crédito y servicio existentes en nuestro portafolio,

 ReqID: 19000881Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Jan 15, 2019, 4:32:16 PM

Full Stack Big Data Engineer
 
American Express is on an exciting transformation journey driven by an energetic new team of high-performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative data driven payment products using Java and API techniques to join our transformation team!
 
You will be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team responsible for delivering world class Omnichannel cardmember experiences and personal integration through java services and data driven solution on Big Data stack and APIs. You will be challenged with identifying innovative and transformative ideas and proof of concept to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers.
They must have strong experience using Big Data stack of technologies , services and API techniques / frameworks to enable digital servicing across channels. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their service concepts. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.
Key Responsibilities:
 
Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to build capabilities to enable
digital footprint to drive business solutions.
Augment data driven model outputs and render as service components to drive hyper personalization and new data driven product development.
Perform technical aspects of software development for assigned applications including design, developing prototypes, automated testing, and hands- on coding assignments of various technologies.
Function as a strong team contributor on an agile team by contributing to software builds through consistent development practices (tools, common components, and documentation).
Strong OpenSource concepts and enable and adapt.
Perform code reviews and automated testing, build and adapt CICD.
Debug software components and identify code defects for remediation
