Discover opportunities with Global Servicing Network 
Just beginning your career in customer service? American Express offers world class leadership and career development. We are looking for people beginning their career to come and join a world class leader in premium servicing. 
Unexpected things happen every day. And when they happen to our customers, we’re there to help them get back on track. By joining Global Servicing Network, you’ll be a part of an enthusiastic team of individuals who go above and beyond to accomplish the extraordinary every day. You’ll have the opportunity to deliver on our brand promise by providing world-class service to our consumer, small business, merchant and corporate customers with your skills, experience and talent. You’ll focus on achieving best-in-class economics, generating loyalty and doing business with utmost integrity and attention to detail.
What’s in it for you?


Attractive base pay

Highly competitive performance-based bonus

Health, dental, vision and life insurance

Free HMO coverage from day 1 for the employee and dependents. No maximum number of dependents. Employee may enroll as many as possible as their dependent so long as they're eligible.

Retirement Fund

Career development including trainings and career growth

Generous maternity/paternity paid leave

Private mother’s room

Onsite gym

Fitness studio

Fun karaoke room

On-site clinic
Job Responsibilities:


Deliver extraordinary customer care by responding to questions concerning customer accounts in a fast paced, structured customer care environment.

Talk and react personally to whatever the circumstances and assist our customers to understand potential issues and how we can assist.

Listen to the real need, find what you can give the customer that they don’t know is there and create powerful solutions to get the job done the first time.

Grow and nurture customer relationships on every interaction that results in measurable customer value.

Deliver extraordinary results measured by customer satisfaction, effectiveness, efficiency and quality.

Take pride in delivering great service in a fun environment that celebrates recognition, as well as a vibrant, fast paced and diverse culture.

Demonstrated consultative experience, ability to influence, resourceful

There are hundreds of opportunities to make your mark on technology and life at American Express. Here’s just some of what you’ll be doing:

• Instrumental as a core member of an agile team defining and driving the latest technology architecture and development practices based on Open Source architecture.
• Writing code and unit tests for key framework and foundation components in all aspects of technology and automation.
• Identifying opportunities for adopting new technology to solve problems in a matrixed environment.
• Providing direction and foresight to a team of engineers that delivers knowledge management solutions to businesses worldwide.

Qualifications
Preferably a BS or MS degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other technical discipline.
8+ years of software development experience.
Ability to effectively interpret technical and business objectives and challenges and articulate innovative solutions that often disrupt the status-quo in order to solve existing problems.
Willingness to learn new technology and ability to come up to speed quickly in order to exploit them to their optimal potential.

Every member of our team must be able to demonstrate the following technical, functional, leadership and business core competencies, including:

• Programming Languages and Frameworks - Java/J2EE,JBPM, REST ,JavaScript ES6, Nodejs, Reactjs, HTML5, CSS3, JSON, Cloud computing, relational and NoSQL databases, Microservices, Business Process Management. Working knowledge of Docker, PaaS architecture , Cloud native ,preferred.
• Agile Practices of Software development - Scrum, Kanban.
• Ability to design systems with inherent high resiliency and availability.
• Provide turnkey technical solutions to complex problems at a global scale.

• Experience working with Business Process Management (BPM) technologies is a plus.


Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

Asesor de Ventas Face to Face
Descripción
El Asesor de Ventas en American Express tendrá como responsabilidad principal la venta de tarjetas de Crédito y Servicio a nuevos clientes, de manera presencial (modulo y citas), mediante una efectiva perfilación de clientes con alto poder adquisitivo, y construyendo con ellos relaciones a largo plazo a través de un seguimiento postventa.
Responsabilidades
Realizar la venta directa de tarjetas de crédito y servicio existentes en nuestro portafolio de manera mensual, lograr la activación de dichas tarjetas en un periodo máximo de 3 meses a la fecha de venta, y lograr una facturación por tarjeta de acuerdo a lo establecido por el canal, dando seguimiento post-venta.

Técnicas de Venta y Habilidades Comerciales.
Comunicación efectiva (verbal y escrita).
Solución de problemas.
Construcción de relaciones.
Enfoque a resultados.
Tolerancia a la frustración.
Manejo del estrés.
Adaptabilidad al cambio.
Enfoque al cliente.
Proactivo.
Manejo de objeciones
Trabajo en equipo
Extrovertido, empático y competitivo.
 
Educación

Estudios mínimos de preparatoria.
Manejo básico de Microsoft Office (Word, Excel).
Manejo de Microsoft Outlook.
Entendimiento básico del idioma inglés.

Bono de contratación los primeros 5 meses por curva de aprendizaje.

You won’t just shape the world of software.
You’ll shape the world of life, work and play.
 
Our Software Engineers not only understand how technology works, but how that technology intersects with the people who count on it every day. Today, innovative ideas, insight and new perspectives are at the core of how we create a more powerful, persona play.l and fulfilling experience for all our customers. So if you’re interested in a career creating breakthrough software and making an impact on an audience of millions, look no further.
At American Express, Enterprise Platform team was created in 2018, as part of the company’s Framework for Winning.  Core to our purpose is reimagining the platform solution-delivery model to dramatically improve our strategic agility, speed to market, effectiveness of delivery and transparency. Our teams create solutions on Salesforce platform by harnessing the power of Data, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence to offer powerful selling and re-selling engines to acquire new clients and expand existing client relationships for 20K + Sales, CRM, and Marketers across the Enterprise.
We are looking for a Salesforce.com Senior Engineer to help lead our Marketing Salesforce team in order to drive our company’s strategic imperatives using the latest and greatest Salesforce products and frameworks.
 
Responsibilities:
 
·        A core member of an Agile engineering team driving User story analysis & elaboration, design and development of software applications, testing and build automation tools
·        Driving continuous improvement in platform structure and quality
·        Participating in gate reviews and quality control over product deployments
·        Identifying opportunities for adopting new technologies to solve existing needs and predicting future challenges
·        Working with product managers to prioritize features for ongoing sprints and managing a list of technical requirements based on industry trends, new technologies, known defects, and issues
·        Leading, coaching and mentoring Engineering resources to ensure quality delivery and the adoption of best practice.
 

Qualifications
 
 

·        8+ years in Software Development
·        5+ years experience in Cloud Technology and an in-depth understanding of the primary concepts and terminology
·        5+ years working on Salesforce applications (Lightning is a must-have.)
·        5+ years experience using Force.com (Advanced understanding of SFDC Triggers and Controllers, VF page development, sObjects, SOQL etc)
·        3+ year hands-on experience in an Agile development team
·        Experience in object oriented development is a must
·        Experience with SOAP and REST Web Services and integration using APIs is a must
·        Experience with source control, branching strategies and using code repositories a must
·        Salesforce certification preferred
·        Background in leveraging ETL products and tools (e.g. IBM DataStage, Informatica, etc.) for data management is preferred
·        Previous experience of Test Driven development is preferred
·        Previous experience in a lead role within a team of engineers
·        Advanced understanding of the Salesforce platform and its primary functions.
·        Ability to learn new technologies and embrace the challenge learning presents
·        A self-starter, comfortable having conversations with business partners
·        Robust and current knowledge of web standards, emerging technologies, and trends
·        Ability to think abstractly and deal with ambiguous/under-defined problems
·        An excellent communicator, both verbally and written.

Why American Express?
 
There’s a difference between having a job and making a difference.
 
American Express has been making a difference in people’s lives
for over 160 years, backing them in moments big and small, granting
access, tools, and resources to take on their biggest challenges and reap
the greatest rewards.
 
We’ve also made a difference in the lives of our people, providing
a culture of learning and collaboration, and helping them with what they
need to succeed and thrive. We have their backs as they grow their skills,
conquer new challenges, or even take time to spend with their family or
community. And when they’re ready to take on a new career path, we’re
right there with them, giving them the guidance and momentum into the best
future they envision.
 
Because we believe that the best way to back our customers is to
back our people.
 
The powerful backing of American Express.
Don’t make a difference without it.
Don’t live life without it.

The world’s best colleague digital experience. That’s what we deliver. Everywhere. Every single day. American Express’s global employees and contractors (we call them colleagues) are served by an award-winning Digital Workplace team that enables communication, connection, collaboration and productivity – and we’re just getting started.
 
We’re looking for someone who has experience working across a broad range of technologies to be a thought-leader and evangelist who can drive the strategic agenda across all teams who build workplace technology within the company.
 
Who you are:
 
You think of yourself as a deeply technical person and you’re as comfortable mentoring other engineers on how to write outstanding code as you are thinking about how data flows and enterprise systems need to fit together. You are at home in a matrixed organization and enjoy the challenge of bringing your dynamic partners on board to your vision. You lead by influence. You love to show your skills through measurable results.
 
The organization we belong to exists to enable American Express colleagues, so you are capable of walking a mile in their shoes and probably harbour a real passion for user experience. Right now, this position doesn’t direct a team of other engineers, but there could be opportunities for this to change in the future.
 
Are these things you like to do?

Provide the thought-leadership required to transform an organization from one focused on implementing package software into one that builds its own
Mentoring product and engineering teams to incorporate industry and American Express standard methodology into the way work is done (e.g. CI/CD, cloud-native applications, single page applications)
Intervene where when teams are making decisions that are contradictory or going to leave us with a mountain of technical debt and then take measures for others to learn and prevent from occurring again
Evaluate emerging technology and work out how it might fit into the digital workplace ecosystem to add valuable contributions to the colleague experience
Help identify, attract, recruit and retain the right talent for the organization
Work at a highly inclusive company that sincerely embraces flexible working conditions and environmentsQualificationsYou have:

A genuine and rare passion to build the world’s best colleague digital experience
A consistent track record working with a broad set of technologies, allowing you to constructively engage with front-end developers, infrastructure gurus, information security, and UX/UI teams
Led the way in multiple, large-scale initiatives in a complex enterprise environment, including at least one that focused on workplace (colleague-facing) technology
The ability to generate excitement, agreement, and followership among your fellow engineers
A bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer science engineering, or related field
Experience working with at least two of the following domains: Digital workplace (e.g. unified communications, enterprise mobility, social/intranet), Big data and machine learning, Automation and CI/CD, Modern front-end development stacks, Cloud-native applications
Employment
eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the
company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

New York, New York; Phoenix, Arizona

Description:
At American Express Enterprise Architecture, our mission is to help our developer community meet the evolving needs of both our company and customers. We help design and build what is needed, envision what is next, and bring the benefits of advanced technology to life. We contribute to shaping the long-term technological vision for American Express and play an important part in shaping the company's future success.

 
As an Engineer within Enterprise Architecture, you will be instrumental in providing world-class tools, training, and support to our community of developers. You will be instrumental in enabling and maintaining high quality products and services to our internal developer community by solving large challenges and empowering teams with world class tools, training, and collaborative support that give insight into the health of their application and domain. You will work with teams to overcome technical obstacles, answering questions and proposing solutions on-the-fly. You will find the work exciting, fun, and challenging.

Employment eligibility to work with American Express
in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for
these positions.QualificationsQualifications: 

Strong communicator with both technical and non-technical peers
Proven success in, and genuine enthusiasm for, working directly with technical teams to empower them through mentorship and training 
Willingness to be hands-on with technical teams, and undergo a technical screening by the Enterprise Architecture team as part of the interview process
You stay on top of tech trends and best practices by experimenting with and learning new technologies, and participating in community of practice groups
You will be challenged to:

Aid in the design, implementation and oversight of scalable software systems
Foster developing and spreading best practices as it pertains to building software inside the American Express ecosystem
Help guide technological strategy across multiple lines of business
Enable thousands of developers through the design and creation of best in class tooling
Increase enterprise velocity by identifying software that needs assistance and transformation across platforms and systems
A successful first 12 months looks like:
 

Assist with the design, development, and gain adoption for Platform Architecture Review refresh (PAR 2.0) that brings insight into the operational and developmental health of our development teams to the enterprise.
Help design, develop, and gain adoption for System Architecture Review refresh (SAR 2.0) that reduces governance to the bare minimum needed to reliably protect the brand and maintain regulatory compliance.
Help automate the data ingestion and date processing of PAR and SAR regulatory dimensions to the highest degree possible, enabling Continuous Architecture across the entire technical ecosystem.
Help with implementation of technological strategy across multiple, complex lines of businessWhy American Express?

Do the right thing for our customers, our company and your career.
 
The EMEA Merchant Credit Team under Global Commercial Credit servicing the EMEA markets (Austria, Finland, France, Germany, Netherlands, Spain, Sweden, UK & Multicurrency). The team deals with merchant debit balance collections, insolvencies and write-off prevention. This role is within the collection function.
 
This is an excellent opportunity to join a positive, multicultural and multilingual team servicing our merchants.
 
Responsibilities include:


Striking a balance between risk assessment and Customer Care.
Collection of outstanding balances on merchant accounts arising from refunds, chargebacks and incorrect payments to minimise exposure and prevent write-offs.
Inbound and Outbound calls with some back office tasks.
Management of debit balance inventory.

Description:
Why American Express?
There’s a difference between having a job and making a difference.

Discover Opportunities with Global Servicing Network
Just beginning your career in customer service? American Express offers world class leadership and career development. We are looking for people beginning their career to come and join a world class leader in premium servicing.
 
Unexpected things happen every day. And when they happen to our customers, we’re there to help them get back on track. By joining Global Servicing Network, you’ll be a part of an enthusiastic team of individuals who go above and beyond to accomplish the extraordinary every day. You’ll have the opportunity to deliver on our brand promise by providing world-class service to our consumer, small business, merchant and corporate customers with your skills, experience and talent. You’ll focus on achieving best-in-class economics, generating loyalty and doing business with utmost integrity and attention to detail.

What’s in it for you?


Attractive base pay

Highly competitive performance-based bonus

Health, dental, vision and life insurance

Free HMO coverage from day 1 for the employee and dependents. No maximum number of dependents. Employee may enroll as many as possible as their dependent so long as they're eligible.

Retirement Fund

Career development including trainings and career growth

Generous maternity/paternity paid leave

Private mother’s room

Onsite gym

Fitness studio

Fun karaoke room

On-site clinic
Job Responsibilities:


Deliver extraordinary customer care by responding to questions concerning customer accounts in a fast paced, structured customer care environment.

Talk and react personally to whatever the circumstances and assist our customers to understand potential issues and how we can assist.

Listen to the real need, find what you can give the customer that they don’t know is there and create powerful solutions to get the job done the first time.

Grow and nurture customer relationships on every interaction that results in measurable customer value.

Deliver extraordinary results measured by customer satisfaction, effectiveness, efficiency and quality.

Take pride in delivering great service in a fun environment that celebrates recognition, as well as a vibrant, fast paced and diverse culture.
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.QualificationsQualifications:
 

Minimum work experience of 2 years of customer service experience in a be in a related industry, over the phone or customer facing, with a passion for building customer loyalty through exceptional listening, relationship building, and strong written and verbal communication
Ability to work in a fast paced metric driven environment with proficient multitasking and navigation
Demonstrated consultative experience, ability to influence, resourceful
Creative problem-solving, eager to find customized solutions
Experience in banking/financial services a must
Experience in servicing Canada market preferred
Bachelor’s degree, associate’s degree and college undergrads may apply     
If you are passionate about serving customers, results driven and interested in working for a world-class global brand, then Global Servicing Network at American Express may be an ideal fit for you.
 
Apply Now! 
 
There are two ways to apply. They both go through the same process and include an online assessment. It’s up to you which one you choose. You can either apply online now or walk-in from Monday to Friday anytime from 9am-5pm at the following address:
 
American Express Recruitment Centre28F, Bonifacio One Technology Tower3030 Rizal Drive WestBonifacio Global City, TaguigMetro Manila

You’ll do more than the expected. You’ll do the unexpected. 

The core function of the ASG& Authorizations teams is to handle incoming and outgoing calls and provide an excellent first point of contact experience for our Card Members, Merchants and Partners.  As a Team member you will specialize in two main functions, Account Protection and Authorization.  
 
As Account Protection Specialist your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  


Taking incoming and outgoing calls
Verifying charges with our Card members
Developing an understanding of potential fraud risks and taking the necessary steps to forward and highlight relevant information within the organization
Working closely with other departments to ensure a high standard of customer service and the appropriate action to be taken to investigate and were applicable recharge fraudulent charges




 
In your function as Member of the Authorization team you will:


Take inbound calls from our Card members and Merchants
In contact with our Card members, focus on spend enablement and make decisions in regards to allowing for charges
Support Card members with authorization of transactions in circumstances which might not be the norm
Support Merchants with Address verifications
Provide Merchants with Authorization codes for transactions
Support Merchants with Approvals and Cancellations of transactions

Why American Express?
 
There’s a difference between having a job and
making a difference.
 
American Express has been making a difference
in people’s lives for over 160 years, backing them in moments big and
small, granting access, tools, and resources to take on their biggest
challenges and reap the greatest rewards.
 
We’ve also made a difference in the lives of
our people, providing a culture of learning and collaboration, and helping
them with what they need to succeed and thrive. We have their backs as
they grow their skills, conquer new challenges, or even take time to spend
with their family or community. And when they’re ready to take on a new
career path, we’re right there with them, giving them the guidance and
momentum into the best future they envision.
 
Because we believe that the best way to back
our customers is to back our people.
 
The powerful backing of American Express.
Don’t make a difference without it.
Don’t live life without it.

Experience   

Bachelor’s Degree in related field preferred; Relevant industry experience can substitute
8+ years of engineering and/or architecture experience in a complex environment, such as: large scale web infrastructure or development team
Experience supporting a 24/7 enterprise environment with on-call responsibilities for production support
Experience in a broad range of software development and operations technologies such as Infrastructure, virtualization, load balancing, containers, JVM’s, web servers, application debugging, queueing technologies, caching technologies, databases (RDBMS and NoSQL), routing and switching, etc.
Experience in high transaction volume OLTP sites or the Financial Services industry is preferredHigh-performing Behaviors
Has an ‘Automation First” mindset – fundamentally will not accept doing things over and over by hand
Combines deep technical expertise, a continuous improvement and automation mindset, and systematic and rational root cause analysis to identify opportunities to make things faster and better
Challenges the status quo, identifies opportunities to adopt innovative technologies to enable business capabilities, generates creative ideas and solutions to difficult problems
A recognized expert and highly sought-after consultant that is knowledgeable regarding current research and technology in the industry and uses that knowledge to continually improve the function
Highly influential at all levels including peers, leaders and key stakeholders, distilling complex ideas and concepts with clear, structured, easy to understand language
Adapts to change quickly and easily and helps others adjust to changes through effective communication
Knows when to escalate decisions and when to make on-the-spot decisions
Knowledge/Skills   
Knowledge of DevOps related practices such as CI/CD, Canary Pushes/ Blue-Green deployments, Software Defined Infrastructure and tools and etc.
Ability to guide and implement the scripting or development of production support tooling that can be leveraged by your team and others.
Understanding of multi-tier application architectures and related development technologies in support of service virtualization and API implementation/support  
Ability to write and build code and/or interpret and understand code
Experience with helping drive story/non-functional/functional test planning
Ability to create and update operating procedures on an ongoing basis
Ability to assess logging and understanding value
Knowledge and understanding of the SDLC principles and key controls
Understand problem and incident management processes
Ability to ensure appropriate database technology is recommended based on application of knowledge and the given software needs   
Working knowledge of operations to include certificate management, firewall rules, websites, XaaS, load balancer configuration, website virtualizations (VM’s and containers), etc.
Knowledge of financial industry standards and business practices
Large scale application support experience
Deep understanding of *nix technologies, e.g. AIX, RedHat and CentOS
Exposure to web frameworks
Knowledge of configuration management, release automation, and orchestration technologies
Experience working with enterprise applications to include queueing or shared services technologies
Understanding monitoring technologies, focused on logging, time-series or machine-learning products from a product owners’ perspective

American Express are looking to add to our enthusiastic French speaking teams who deliver class leading levels of Customer Service across the business.

American Express is a Top 10 Glass Door employer and Fortune’s 100 ‘Top Company to Work For’ award winner. We are defined by our ability to innovate, evolve and take risks and always put our customer at the centre of everything we do. With many other awards including: ‘Working Mothers’ and being voted one of the Top 10 Employers in the UK by Working Families, we are proud to be the UK's leading work-life balance organisation which is only a small part of what makes us the successful dynamic fortune 500 company we are today.
 
Nowhere do these values hold truer than in our exciting and dynamic European language centre in Brighton. Servicing operations across Europe, this office delivers a diverse, fast paced environment which promotes development opportunities for all colleagues who are motivated to advance their careers.  
 
Our Customer Service teams are at the forefront of delivering for our customers, ensuring that we do the right thing in every interaction in order to provide an excellent service each and every time. 
 
While we would love the opportunity to discuss the various responsibilities our teams have, all teams are required to:


Deliver extraordinary service to our customers
Partner with various business areas
Do what is right by the customer
Live and breathe the American Express values and brand
Commit to providing exceptional products, service and experiences for our customers
Strive to improve our existing ideas in order to find more ways to win

 
Offer of employment with American Express is
conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check,
subject to applicable laws and regulations.Qualifications
Required skills
 
Previous experience is not important to us. We value motivated and enthusiastic colleagues who strive to do what is best for our customers and demonstrate the following:


Fluency in French and English
Flexibility in an ever changing environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong, reliable team player
Customer orientated

 
Why
American Express?

American Express Campus Graduate – 2019 Data Scientists / Analytics Managers / Product Managers Full-Time Opportunities in Credit & Fraud Risk
　
Purposeful, ambitious, insatiable, analytical, collaborative and courageous are the hallmarks of our Credit and Fraud Risk team. 
This critical team is responsible for managing enterprise risks through the customer lifecycle and across all our global products. We develop industry-first data capabilities, build profitable decision-making frameworks, create machine learning-powered predictive models, and improve customer servicing strategies. This team has delivered industry-leading results year after year while enabling profitable growth and delivering a best-in-class customer experience. 
 
This team is structured under four core functions:
 
Credit Risk Strategy: Monitor credit portfolios and optimize profit-based risk management decisions at all stages of the customer credit lifecycle
Fraud Risk Strategy: Develop fraud prevention strategies on behalf of our customers
Decision Science: Build predictive models using AI/Machine Learning for all portfolios and products
Risk Capabilities: Develop technical solutions and capabilities to manage data and execute credit and fraud risk strategies
　
What Type of Work Will I Do
You will work in a highly dynamic and exciting environment working closely with colleagues in other Risk Management teams, Marketing, Finance, Servicing, Legal, Compliance, Banking, and Technology to create world-class analytical solutions.

The key responsibilities include:
Develop and continuously enhance predictive models, strategies, processes, and controls for mitigating credit risk exposure and preventing fraud using advanced statistical and Machine Learning techniques such as Gradient Boosting Machine, deep learning, and lookalike modeling.
Design customer communication and servicing strategies to support risk management strategies, ensuring a positive experience across every customer touchpoint
Work in close partnership with American Express Technology to translate the needs of business owners/stakeholders and manage delivery of the Product roadmap and deploy next generation risk management capabilities, designed for long-term adaptability
Conduct quantitative analysis to decide the thresholds within which consumers and businesses can access funds (for example: who is approved for a card, how much credit line do they receive, and when they swipe their card, is their transaction approved?)
Identify, evaluate, and integrate new data sources and capabilities to identify emerging credit trends and uncover new fraud patterns
Maintain an effective control environment and respond to operational breakdowns with discipline
　Qualifications
What We Are Looking For
Advanced degree (e.g., MS, PhD, or MBA) in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Engineering, Computer Science, Econometrics or Physics
Blend of analytical skills, process expertise, project management, and relationship-building skills
Ability to think strategically and apply both quantitative methods and business insights to drive results
Experience working with statistical and data mining techniques, including regression analysis and Machine Learning tools for pattern recognition and predictive analytics
Ability to handle large datasets using SAS, SQL, R, Python or another similar programming language
Thought leadership and solution-oriented mindset
Ability to build strong relationships in a cross-functional environment
Clear, effective written and oral communication skills

Educational Requirements:
Currently enrolled in a full-time graduate degree program
Students must have a graduation date between December 2018 and June 2019
 
Life at American Express
American Express is known for backing our customers to help them achieve their goals and dreams, big and small. At American Express, we’re changing the way people live and work through meaningful projects with real-world impact. When you join our team you can make a difference by improving the everyday lives of customers around the world. 
　
Growing great leaders is one of the things that sets American Express apart. Every employee has the opportunity—and is encouraged—to take their personal leadership to the next level through a wide variety of leadership and learning programs.
　
Our employees and their families feel supported at every stage of their lives. We provide resources and benefits that help support their physical, financial, and emotional well-being, such as our award-winning global corporate wellness program, Healthy Living, and many others including: 20 weeks of paid parental leave, health (dental and vision) and life insurance, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match. Some of our roles even offer flexible work arrangements so you can work how it makes sense for you, without compromising our commitment to our colleagues, customers, and shareholders. 
Creating an inclusive culture is both a part of who we are and what we do together. We value and embrace the diversity of thought, backgrounds and experiences of all our employees. Through our 15 Employee Networks, participants can broaden their associations with other employees while expanding their knowledge of the business. American Express is a place where being yourself matters. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
　
Why Work at American Express:
There’s a difference between having a job and making a difference.
　
American Express has been making a difference in people’s lives for over 160 years, backing them in moments big and small, granting access, tools, and resources to take on their biggest challenges and reap the greatest rewards.
　
We’ve also made a difference in the lives of our people, providing a culture of learning and collaboration, and helping them with what they need to succeed and thrive. We have their backs as they grow their skills, conquer new challenges, or even take time to spend with their family or community. And when they’re ready to take on a new career path, we’re right there with them, giving them the guidance and momentum into the best future they envision.
　
Because we believe that the best way to back our customers is to back our people.
　
The powerful backing of American Express.
Don’t make a difference without it.
Don’t live life without it.

Job Title: Campus Graduate – 2019 Data Scientists / Analytics Managers / Product Managers Full-Time Opportunities in Credit & Fraud Risk

Description:
Our Software Engineers not only understand how technology works, but how that technology intersects with the people who count on it every day. Today, innovative ideas, insight and new perspectives are at the core of how we create a more powerful, personal and fulfilling experience for all our customers. So, if you’re interested in a career creating breakthrough software and making an impact on an audience of millions, look no further. American Express has embarked on an exciting modernization and transformation journey that is driven by an energetic new team of high performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. In this role, you will contribute to a start-up engineering team which will deliver the next generation, Highly Available, Authorization & Settlement Platform for the mission critical American Express Merchant Transformation Initiative. 
 
You won’t just keep up, you’ll break new ground. 
 
There are hundreds of opportunities to make your mark on technology and life at American Express. Here’s just some of what you’ll be doing:

You will be serving as a core member of an engineering team that takes ownership and drives design, development and implementation of software applications
You will be writing code and unit tests, working on API specs, automation, and testing
You will be identifying exciting opportunities for adopting new technologies to solve existing needs and predicting future challenges
You will be performing ongoing refactoring of code, utilizing visualization and other techniques to fast-track concepts, and delivering continuous improvement
You will be designing and developing rest based endpoints and consumption of the restful API’s
You will be developing deep understanding of tie-ins with other systems and platformsQualificationsQualifications

We are looking for Engineers that have a Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent work experience 
We are looking for Engineers that have a passion for working in a fast-paced Agile SaFe environment.
We are looking for Engineers that are familiar with Build tools (Maven, Gradle)
We are looking for Engineers that are familiar with Container based development (Docker, vagrant, puppet)
We are looking for Engineers that are familiar with Reactive frameworks RXJava, spring reactor, vert.x to achieve better fault isolation and scalability.
We are looking for Engineers that have a willingness to learn new technologies and exploit them to their optimal potential
 
At the core of Software Engineering

Every member of our team must be able to demonstrate the following technical, functional, leadership and business core competencies, including:
Agile Practices
Porting/Software Configuration
Programming Languages and Frameworks
Business Analysis
Analytical Thinking
Business Product Knowledge
Why American Express 
Talk to our people and you’ll find out what we’re really all about. Open, creative, risk-taking, collaborative and innovative are just some of the expressions you’ll hear. It’s our culture that makes American Express an outstanding place to work, and a big part of why we regularly win best workplace awards all over the world. If you’re ready to take on a challenge and make an impact, you owe it to yourself to launch or grow your career here.Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

 ReqID: 18012261Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Oct 4, 2018, 12:15:58 AM

American Express has embarked on an exciting modernization and transformation journey that is driven by an energetic new team of high performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative payment products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team.  Contribute to a rock star start-up engineering team which will deliver the next generation  highly  available, cloud native platform for the mission critical American Express platform modernization initiative. 
 
The platform will leverage modern programming languages i.e. Java, Node.js, and Go Lang, which will enable new payment products and support our existing business.  Create an innovative platform that is virtualized in Native Cloud, and can be deployed regionally to support local business while remaining compliant to regional regulatory needs.  The role will provide you with an opportunity to identifyi innovative ideas and proofs of concept to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers.As a  Director of Platform Delivery, the primary responsibilities will be to build a robust, efficient, effective, 24x7 data processing Platform and its tools. We are a start-up, we will wear many hats, work fast and smart, and adapt and iterate quickly. The incumbent needs to work closely with their  US counterparts to deliver a data processing platform that is capable of powering the American Express payments.Responsibilities Include:

Fostering innovation and experimentation, delivering software solutions that exceed customer and stakeholder expectations
 Providing  technical leadership and apply best practices to further leading-edge solutions
 Leading an Agile Release Train following SAFe Principles
 Ensuring  product releases are of high quality, that delivers excellent user experiences, and is compliant  with regulatory requirements
 Liaising  with the product teams and establishing highly collaborative partnerships 
Developing a fun culture enabling high employee engagement and cohesive, collaborative teams across domains and locations
 Collaborate with a wide variety to stakeholders within business and technology teams to drive change required to execute product roadmaps
 Leading a team in an environment which includes modern web frameworks, continuous integration/continuous delivery tool chains, and the full software development lifecycle
using  industry research and emerging technologies to ensure we are appropriately leveraging new techniques and capabilities
 Recruit and cultivate top talent by driving technical and leadership developmentQualifications
Qualifications

Bachelor’s in  Computer Science / Information Systems degree, or equivalent 
Overall 8+ years of experience in developing and delivering leading –edge software solutions coupled with a proven experience in building teams from scratch and growing individuals into leaders.
Leadership skills with extensive hands-on experience building and managing the development of complex, large scale enterprise applications and products that require a deep understanding of application logic and dependencies
Agile application development methodology. Knowledge of SAFe 4.5 will be preferred
Hands on development experience in multiple languages including Go, Java, and RESTful API’s along with strong knowledge on databases including modern NoSQL DBs like Couchbase, and Cassandra
Proficiency with technical skills in Node.JS server side JavaScript, or with web application development frameworks 
Development experience with micro services architectures and service mesh technologies
Proficiency with  DevOps and related tools like Splunk, Dynatrace, and AppDynamics
Excellent verbal and written communications skills required, with the ability to create and deliver effective presentations to Senior Leadership across the organization
Good at building relationships and proven ability to influence and drive delivery across a geographical distributed organization 
Hands on development experience in the following environments is preferred: Java,Go, Vert.x, React, Envoy, gRPC, ProtoBuf, JSON, CouchBase, Cassandra, Redis, Consul, Jenkins, docker, Kubernates, OpenShift, Drools, ELK Stack, Kafka, Prometheus
Professional attributes for success: 

Exhibits excellent judgment
Has relentlessly high standards (is never satisfied with the status quo)
